If Volcarona is not using Tera Grass Giga Drain, then Water- and Rock-types like Primarina and Garganacl give it issues; Grass-types like Rillaboom can assist Volcarona in this vein. Trick Room teams invalidate Volcarona's Speed boost, though the Special Defense boost enables it to take attacks from the special attackers on these teams. Another useful tactic is to use physical attackers, as it has worse Defense and cannot improve it with Quiver Dance, though Volcarona can mitigate this issue with Intimidate support.

Bulky Setup Sweeper.description:
• Volcarona utilizes the bulk, power, and Speed granted by Quiver Dance; its useful coverage; and Terastallization, which lets it work its way around its checks, to become difficult to take down and take over games as a result.
  • Tera Blast Fairy lets Volcarona defeat Dragon-types that can stand up to Heat Wave; Giga Drain hits Water- and Rock-types while providing additional recovery to let Volcarona stay on the field longer. Tera Blast is used only on Tera Fairy sets, whereas Giga Drain sees play on Tera Grass and Tera Dragon sets.
  • Covert Cloak lets Volcarona ignore Fake Out to set up or throw out its attacks more freely, and it prevents Snarl, Icy Wind, and Dire Claw from impeding its sweep. Leftovers gives Volcarona passive recovery, augmenting the recovery that Giga Drain provides to be at higher HP to survive more attacks.
  • Tera Fairy lets Volcarona bypass Dragon-type attacks like Dragapult's Dragon Darts and Dragonite's Scale Shot and maintain a resistance to Fighting-type attacks like Sneasler's Close Combat. Tera Grass gives Volcarona a resistance to Water- and Electric-type attacks like Basculegion's Wave Crash and Archaludon's Electro Shot, makes it immune to Amoonguss's Spore, and powers up Giga Drain, turning +1 Giga Drain from a 2HKO into an OHKO on Basculegion and doing the same with +2 Giga Drain for Primarina. This additionally lets it restore more HP in the process, making it more likely to sweep games. Tera Dragon gives Volcarona similar defensive benefits and doesn't make it weak to Pelipper's Hurricane, Sneasler's Dire Claw, and Fire-type attacks like Armarouge's Armor Cannon and Incineroar's Flare Blitz, though it becomes weak to Dragon-type attacks like Dragapult's Dragon Darts and Dondozo's Order Up.
  • 180 Speed EVs and a Timid nature ensure that Volcarona will outspeed Annihilape, as well as other mid-speed Pokemon like Gholdengo and Archaludon. With 164 Special Attack EVs, Tera Blast Fairy will OHKO offensive Dragapult, as well as maximum HP Annihilape after a Quiver Dance. The bulk investment ensures that Volcarona survives a Tera Normal Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B after a Quiver Dance and, after Terastallizing, two Rock Slides from Tyranitar if Leftovers or Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain are in play to neutralize sandstorm damage.
  • Alternatively, Volcarona can lean into its bulk with maximum HP investment, which can benefit from the recovery offered by Giga Drain. After the aforementioned Speed investment to outspeed Annihilape, the rest of the EVs are put into Defense, letting Volcarona survive physical priority moves like Black Glasses Kingambit's Tera Dark Sucker Punch and Choice Band Dragonite's Tera Normal Extreme Speed. Even with minimal Special Defense investment, Volcarona has enough special bulk to survive Pelipper's Hurricane; after a Quiver Dance, it will take a Blood Moon from Tera Normal Life Orb Ursaluna-B or a Choice Scarf Tera Fire Overheat from Hisuian Typhlosion in sun, assuming it hasn't Terastallized into a Grass-type.

Quiver Dance.description:
• Volcarona prefers Flamethrower as its Fire-type STAB move for the OHKO on Amoonguss at +1 and the OHKOs on Assault Vest Rillaboom and Kingambit when at +2. Volcarona uses Tera Blast to threaten Raging Bolt and the Urshifu formes. Giga Drain can be used instead for longevity and a better way to threaten Tera Ogerpon-W.

  • Leftovers' recovery is most effective, as Volcarona is intended to stay on the field from start to finish, Giga Drain and common support enables this.

  • The EVs allow Volcarona to survive Ogerpon-W's Ivy Cudgel, and, when Terastallized and at +1 Special Defense, two Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane Dazzling Gleams. The Speed investment allows for Volcarona to outspeed unboosted Iron Bundle after a Quiver Dance, and the remaining EVs are used to maximize damage.

  • Even when boosted, Volcarona will struggle against the aforementioned Fire-types, so Landorus and Urshifu-R make great teammates. Volcarona is a great answer to Flutter Mane and Rillaboom in return.

  • Volcarona prefers Tera Fairy to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves, while Tera Dragon is another option to resist Urshifu-R's Surging Strikes and Ogerpon-W's STAB moves. Both Tera types synergise with Volcarona's original typing, thanks providing Steel-, Ice-, and Fairy-type resistances.

Tornadus.overview:
• Tornadus is one of the strongest support Pokemon bearing a great toolkit, including Tailwind, Taunt, Rain Dance, and Sunny Day. Prankster provides great speed and weather control. It has a great matchup against Rillaboom and Amoonguss, thanks to Bleakwind Storm, a great spread move which gives it a field presence, and Taunt.

  • Tornadus has amazing synergy with Urshifu-R and fast Pokemon like Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Landorus, which define the archetype of tailwind hyper offense.

  • Tornadus can become vulnerable to certain threats like Urshifu-R, Chien-Pao, and opposing Taunt Tornadus depending on its item choice. Focus Sash struggles against Urshifu-R, and items like Covert Cloak and Mental Herb struggle against Chien-Pao. Rocky Helmet matches poorly into Fake Out and Taunt pressure.

  • Tornadus struggles to create field pressure as a singular Pokemon. It cannot Taunt Pokemon like Farigiraf and Indeedee due to their respective abilities blocking priority. Chien-Pao, Raging Bolt, Iron Hands and Archaludon are bad matchups for it because of their ability to quickly remove it from the field.

Bulky Tailwind.description:
• Bleakwind Storm provides good damage into Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W. Tailwind is the most effective speed control Tornadus has access to. Taunt helps shut down Amoonguss and helps to manage certain Trick Room Pokemon like Porygon2 and Dusclops, but Protect can be run instead to ensure Tailwind goes up. Rain Dance and Sunny Day serve as weather control, which enables your sweepers and disables opposing weather-based sweepers. Rain Dance pairs well with Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W while Sunny Day powers up Chi-Yu and Flutter Mane.

  • This given EV spread focuses on bulk, surviving Mystic Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Fairy Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The low Speed investment ensures that Tornadus sets up its own weather.

  • Rocky Helmet helps against Urshifu-R mirrors and provides good chip into opposing physical attackers making contact. Covert Cloak prevents Fake Out flinches from Incineroar and Rillaboom. It also negates any secondary effects from moves like Rock Slide and Icy Wind. This ensures that Tailwind goes up. Mental Herb helps to shrug off one Taunt.

  • Tera Dark provides an immunity to Prankster Taunt, guaranteeing Tailwind. Tera Steel provides useful resistance to Chien-Pao and Flutter Mane's STAB moves. Both Tera types improve matchups into Psyspam and against Electric-type moves from Pokemon like Raging Bolt, Iron Hands and Archaludon.

Offensive Tailwind.description:
• Focus Sash ensures Tornadus survives one attack and set up Tailwind. Protect becomes important to avoid Fake Out without committing the Tera early.

  • Tornadus rarely Terastallizes, but Tera Ghost can ensure that it can more reliably set up Tailwind by negating Fake Out from Pokemon like Incineroar and Rillaboom, and Extreme Speed from Pokemon like Dragonite and Entei. Tera Flying increases its offensive pressure.

Landorus.overview:
• Landorus is one of the best special attackers in the format currently, as its Sheer Force and Life Orb boosted STAB moves devestate opposing teams and nail prominant threats like Archaludon, Kingambit, Incineroar, and Raging Bolt.

  • However, Landorus has a very crowded Speed tier, thus speed control from Pokemon such as Latias and Tornadus is vital against faster checks like Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Both Pokemon also act as excellent Urshifu-R checks themselves.

  • Fake Out users like Rillaboom and Incineroar can be great teammates too, buying time for Landorus to set up Substitute. Rillaboom also serves as another answer to Urshifu-R, while Incineroar helps dampen the damage from opposing Chien-Pao. Other common Landorus checks include Pokemon that can comfortably ignore Earth Power, namely Latias and Tornadus.

  • Ogerpon-W is also a particularly good teammate, as it can redirect and absorb attacks from Chien-Pao and Urshifu-R while dealing decent damage back.

Life Orb.description:
• Earth Power serves as its main STAB attack, allowing it to hit the majority of the format for good damage.

  • Sludge Bomb is able to deal respectable damage against Ground-resistant foes, such as Rillaboom and Tornadus. Tera Poison can also elevate Sludge Bomb's damage and secure KOs against Rillaboom.

  • Tera Poison in conjunction with 132 HP and 4 Def EVs lets Landorus survive Surging Strikes from Tera Water Urshifu-R the majority of the time. The remaining EVs are used to maximize its Speed and Special Attack.

  • A timely Tera Poison lets Landorus live a Tera Fairy-boosted Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane, as well Ice-type attacks from Chien Pao.

  • Substitute allows Landorus to punish passive plays, mainly switches and Protect. A well-timed Substitute in front of a Kingambit also prevents Landorus from getting knocked out by a potential Sucker Punch. This move can be substituted for Sandsear Storm on Rain teams or when paired with Rain Dance Tornadus.

  • A Timid nature can be considered, allowing Landorus to outspeed faster Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W variants, at the cost of damage.

Landorus-Therian.overview:
• A great STAB combination, a sky-high Attack stat, and Intimidate allow Landorus-T to function well in many different roles. These make it a great Choice Band sweeper, threatening many common metagame threats such as Raging Bolt and Flutter Mane. Landorus-T can also function as a Intimidate pivoter, using its great STAB combination and movepool to provide utility.

  • More offensive Landorus-T sets appreciate speed control support from Tornadus and Icy Wind Flutter Mane, with the former being more consistent by providing Tailwind support and hitting the Grass-types that resist Ground such as Rillaboom, while the latter has excellent offensive synergy. Redirection support from Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss is also appreciated, with both benefiting from Intimidate and Ogerpon-W specifically handling the Ice- and Water-types that give Landorus-T trouble. Choice Scarf Landorus-T partners well with all of the above options; however, it doesn't rely on speed control compared to Choice Band variants.

  • Rillaboom and Ogerpon-W are difficult for Landorus-T to handle, with the former having Fake Out. which is even more potent because Landorus-T almost exclusively runs Choice items, and halving the damage of Earthquake, while the latter has super effective Water-type STAB moves and a way to redirect its Stomping Tantrum; both of these also resist Ground. Incineroar is also an issue, as even though it's weak to Ground, Intimidate and Parting Shot let it constantly debuff Landorus-T, removing the its potential to OHKO many Pokemon. Landorus-T also finds itself difficult to slot into many teams, as each of its individual strong points are better found in other options, such as Incineroar generally being a strong Intimidate pivot and the other Landorus forme being a better offensive threat.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is the best single target Ground-type move available, while Earthquake is used to dish out damage to more foes and bypass Follow Me. Rock Slide hits the Flying-types that are immune to Ground, while U-turn is a strong pivot option that also hits Ground-resistant Grass-types, even having a chance to OHKO frailer Ogerpon formes.

  • Choice Band allows Landorus-T to function as a sweeper, partially negating the low Base Power of its Ground-type moves and giving it rolls to OHKO many prevalent threats such as Raging Bolt, Kingambit, and Flutter Mane.

  • The Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S, Kowtow Cleave from a +1 Attack Black Glasses Kingambit, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W. The Special Defense investment allows Landorus-T to survive a Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed investment outspeeds Adamant Chien-Pao at -1, with the rest being put into Attack.

  • Tera Fairy is generally preferred for being a stronger neutral type into the current metagame. It also resists Sucker Punch from Kingambit, which threatens big damage thanks to its ability Defiant, and other Dark-type attackers, allowing it to wall Urshifu-S.

Damage Oriented Pivot.description:
• Stomping Tantrum is used as the strongest Ground-type move available, with Rock Slide being coverage for Flying-types and U-turn for general utility. Tera Blast Flying gives Landorus-T a Flying-type move, despite coming at a high cost, allowing it to hit the Grass-types that otherwise resist Stomping Tantrum, as well as generally having more flexibility in the matchups it can be brought to.

  • Choice Scarf gives Landorus-T the jump on many of its counters such as Chien-Pao and Ogerpon-W and helps it pivot more easily with U-turn.

  • The EV spread still survives Wicked Blow from Tera Dark Urshifu-S and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, with the Attack investment guaranteeing an OHKO on Rillaboom with Tera Blast Flying.

  • Tera Flying is used to give Landorus-T a Flying-type STAB move with Tera Blast and remove its Water-type weakness.

Talonflame.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Talonflame is most common as the main supportive option on teams that aim to overwhelm the opponent and win quickly, such as hyper offense, where priority speed control in the form of Tailwind is especially valuable. Its most common partner by far is Choice Specs Gholdengo, which, when paired with Covert Cloak Talonflame, prevents Fake Out and makes it difficult to stop a turn one Tailwind + Tera Steel Make it Rain. This duo is also particularly strong with Dondozo and Commander Tatsugiri, softening up teams for Dondozo to clean up in the endgame.
  • Talonflame doesn't particularly need any partners to function well; it instead serves to complement its teammates.
  • Talonflame's main competition is Whimsicott, which doesn't have to worry about about losing access to priority moves thanks to Prankster, as well as having better enabling tools such as Sunny Day for Hisuian Typhlosion and Delphox and Beat Up for Annihilape. Talonflame has more general utility tools with Will-O-Wisp and non-Prankster Taunt, is faster, and can OHKO it first with priority Brave Bird, but it generally isn't as support-oriented as Whimsicott.

Strategy Comments

  • Talonflame's biggest strength is immediate turn one pressure. Take advantage of that. You generally always want to be leading Talonflame and setting up Tailwind; going for an attack is risky before Tailwind is up, as you lose Gale Wings and a significant chunk of Talonflame's health. Once Tailwind is up, sacrificing it for a free switch is usually the play. If you have the opportunity for a safe switch, however, take it, as Talonflame's coverage and Speed makes it a great late-game cleaner.
  • The only real reason to use Talonflame over Whimsicott is coverage and damage, functioning almost like a glass cannon with access to priority Tailwind. Flying- and Fire-type coverage is excellent into the metagame, and its Speed means it's always a credible threat. Go for damage whenever possible after setting up Tailwind.
  • The best way to handle Talonflame is to nullify either its damage or priority speed control. Pokemon with Intimidate severely hamper Talonflame's offensive pressure, and even Pokemon like Electabuzz and Primarina that can eat one of its attacks and return back for strong damage are difficult matchups. Alternatively, nullifying its priority or Speed advantage also works well. Priority attacks like Fake Out and Extreme Speed break Gale Wings, with the former often completely preventing Tailwind from being set up on non-Covert Cloak sets. Priority blocking abilities like both Indeedee's Psychic Surge are difficult but not common. Incineroar is likely the biggest pain spot for Talonflame teams, as it walls Gholdengo, can break Gale Wings with Fake Out, and has Intimidate to cripple Talonflame offensively. If you're playing Talonflame, you have to be careful when leading it into Incineroar and Sneasler teams, and usually, it's best to completely leave it behind in matchups against balance teams.

Offensive Tailwind Support.description:
• Talonflame takes over for Tornadus as the premier offensive Tailwind support, dealing huge damage with its primary STAB attacks that give it immediate offensive pressure as well as having a host of supportive options with Gale Wings Tailwind.
  • Covert Cloak is the most popular item on Talonflame, preventing opposing Fake Outs from slowing down a offensive lead. Talonflame's high Speed means it's usually not too bothered by Gale Wings breaking. Life Orb and Sharp Beak are two sides of the same coin; they are offensive items to pick up OHKOes on foes that Covert Cloak sets don't at the cost of being vulnerable to Fake Out. Life Orb allows for cleaner OHKOes such as OHKOing Rillaboom regardless of its defensive investment as well as boosting Flare Blitz, while Sharp Beak is an option if you prefer not taking recoil at the cost of damage output, such as only having a 60% chance to OHKO the previously mentioned Rillaboom.
  • The choice of Tera type is mostly dependent on personal preference. Tera Ghost prevents Fake Out, Extreme Speed, and other priority moves from breaking Gale Wings. Tera Flying is used for damage, allowing Sharp Beak and Life Orb sets to cleanly OHKO Amoonguss, as well as some frail neutral types such as Delphox and Hisuian Typhlosion, with Brave Bird. Tera Grass gives a resistance to Water, Electric, and an important immunity to powder attacks; this is used to bypass opposing Rage Powders and Taunt an opposing Trick Room user on turn one.
  • Jolly is usually preferred for outspeeding Adamant Dragapult, Whimsicott, and Sneasler, but Adamant is also viable to maximize damage, allowing it to OHKO Amoonguss without Terastallization on Life Orb sets.
  • The last two moveslots are open to player preference and usually mix and matched, the usual 2 are Flare Blitz and Taunt, giving it an additional STAB move and extra utility, respectively, but Will-O-Wisp and Protect are also viable; the former cripples physical threats like Dondozo, and the latter is generally useful.

Vivillon.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Vivillon works well on offensive teams, acting as a fast sleep support Pokemon while still hitting hard into defensive pieces like Rillaboom and Amoonguss. Sleep Powder can shut down slower foes such as Annihilape and Primarina, keeping the momentum for offensive threats like Garchomp. Vivillon also works well on balance, specifically with Porygon2, redirecting or shutting down attacks for Porygon2 while also sitting next to Ursaluna as it uses Earthquake.

  • Thanks to Vivillon's Flying typing, it can be used next to Garchomp and its easily spammable Earthquake amazingly. Earthquake also forces threats such as Archaludon to go for Tera Grass, which then opens up Vivillon to hit hard with Hurricane. Vivillon can also put foes to sleep for Garchomp, which sets it apart from other Flying-types. Gholdengo is another solid partner for Vivillon, benefiting from redirection.

  • Vivillon loses to Maushold and Annihilape as a duo, as Annihilape threatens Vivillon after it Terastallizes, and Maushold can shut down Vivillon by outspeeding it and using Taunt. It can also struggle with Maushold and Archaludon as a duo, with Maushold this time threatening Population Bomb as well as Taunt while Archaludon can take down Vivillon with Electro Shot, Flash Cannon, and Draco Meteor. Garchomp and Gholdengo can patch up these holes; Garchomp's Earthquake hits hard into all of the aforementioned foes, while Gholdengo can do the same with Shadow Ball and Make It Rain. Garchomp also has the added benefit of Rough Skin, damaging Maushold for attacking.

Strategy Comments

  • Vivillon's main role is to put things to sleep with high Speed, hit decently hard, and redirect attacks to protect allies. Vivillon really shines when next to Garchomp, putting slower foes likes Pelipper to sleep and redirecting attacks such as Moonblast from Primarina and Draco Meteor from Hydreigon.

  • Vivillon can be used best in early-game situations and works really well in the lead or even in the back next to Gholdengo, spamming Sleep Powder while Gholdengo uses Make It Rain or using Rage Powder to allow Gholdengo to set up and sweep. Vivillon can also be used next to Primarina, with Hyper Voice and Sleep Powder forcing Tera Grass from foes such as Incineroar, which can then allow Vivillon to hit hard with Hurricane.

  • Vivillon can struggle with Pokemon like Incineroar chipping it down and breaking Focus Sash, and smart pivoting into Grass-types or Safety Goggles Pokemon can make it hard for Vivillon to do its job. For this, Incineroar can work to remove Safety Goggles with Knock Off and KO Grass-types with Flare Blitz. Tera Ghost is also great at preserving Focus Sash, while Protect and good pivoting of your own can help as well.

Support.description:
• Vivillon is a very good support Pokemon, providing redirection and fast sleep while dealing good damage. Compound Eyes helps make Vivillon more consistent as a support Pokemon, making Hurricane and Sleep Powder more accurate.

  • Hurricane does good damage to foes such as Amoonguss and Rillaboom as well as hitting common Tera Grass users like Archaludon, which are forced to Terastallize due to Sleep Powder. Rage Powder, even with Vivillon's low bulk, is able to soak up one or two attacks for allies such as Garchomp.

  • Focus Sash compensates for Vivillon's rather poor defensive stats, granting more turns for it to support its team, specifically allowing for more sleep opportunities.

  • Tera Ghost denies Fake Out from foes like Rillaboom and Incineroar and Extreme Speed from Dragonite, which helps with Vivillon's survivability, as it stops Focus Sash from being broken.

Sylveon.overview:
• Sylveon's solid natural bulk as well as access to absurd damage from Pixilate-boosted Hyper Voice makes it a solid setup sweeper. With its pure Fairy typing, Sylveon boasts a better matchup into Ghost- and Dark-type threats such as Flutter Mane and Urshifu-S than its main Fairy-type competition, Flutter Mane.

  • Sylveon appreciates support from Fake Out and Follow Me, allowing it to set up Throat Spray or Calm Mind more easily. Incineroar makes up for Sylveons middling physical bulk with Parting Shot and Intimidate, as well as handling the Steel- and Fire-types that Sylveon struggles against. Ogerpon-W not only provides Follow Me support but similarly to Incineroar is able to handle Steel- and Fire-type attacks safely. Landorus is a great offensive partner, with it and Sylveon covering each other's checks, as well as making up for Sylveon's low initial damage output.

  • Sylveon's biggest issue is that it struggles to find a slot on most teams due to its competition with Flutter Mane, which is more of an immediate threat thanks to its higher single target damage, higher Speed, and Fake Out immunity from its Ghost typing. While Sylveon has use cases thanks to its bulk and pure Fairy typing, Flutter Mane is easier to fit into most compositions and is able to function well with minimal support. Sylveon's middling Speed means it is vulnerable to being overwhelmed by foes, making utilizing its strong setup options difficult.

Throat Spray Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice allows Sylveon to utilize Throat Spray as well as being a strong spread move after the boost from Pixilate. Misty Terrain allows Sylveon to block Spore from Amoonguss, while Calm Mind is also viable as another way to further increase Sylveonâ€˜s damage output. Quick Attack picks off Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao, which normally run Focus Sash. If Sylveon is running Tera Fire, Tera Blast is also an option to hit Fairy-resistant foes such as Amoonguss and Gholdengo, as well as being a strong single target Fairy-type move before Terastallization thanks to Pixilate.

  • The invested Defense allows Sylveon to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom, as well as Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W. Sylveon is also able to survive a Metal Coat-boosted Make It Rain from Gholdengo. Enough Speed is invested for Sylveon to outspeed Chi-Yu when under Tailwind, with the rest dumped into Special Attack.

  • Both Tera Fire and Water allow Sylveon to check problematic Steel- and Fire-types such as Gholdengo, Incineroar and Assault Vest Kingambit, though Tera Water is generally preferred thanks to having fewer weaknesses to common offensive threats. Tera Fire has valuable resistances to Fairy- and Grass-type moves on top of the coverage with Tera Blast; however, it makes Sylveon weak to more metagame threats, such as Landorus and Ogerpon-W.

Incineroar.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Amoonguss works exceptionally well with Incineroar, protecting it from Water- and Fighting-type attacks such as Basculegionâ€™s Wave Crash and Annihilapeâ€™s Drain Punch. Amoonguss also provides Incineroar with much appreciated healing. In return, Incineroar can handle Gholdengo and switch into Fire-types like Talonflame and Volcarona as well as removing opposing Safety Goggles with Knock Off.
  • Incineroar also works well with Gholdengo, providing Intimidate and Fake Out support to help it set up safely. Gholdengo also takes advantage of Incineroarâ€™s ability to do great damage to Kingambit, considering Gholdengo can blow up Clefable and Sneasler that may attempt to protect Kingambit.
  • Porygon2 and Ursaluna can set up Trick Room and Substitute more easily thanks to Incineroarâ€™s support. Ursaluna can then blow up Pokemon Incineroar struggles to damage like Archaludon and opposing Incineroar.
  • Incineroar can struggle to do its job against Pokemon that threaten it such as Pelipper, the Ursaluna formes, and Annihilape. Bulky support Incineroar can also feel passive at times because of its lackluster damage output, especially when it canâ€™t use Parting Shot because of redirection or Taunt. Therefore, offensive Pokemon like Gholdengo and Ursaluna that can take on these threats and make up for Incineroarâ€™s poor damage output are greatly appreciated.

Strategy Comments

  • Incineroar is an effective support Pokemon and pivot thanks to Fake Out, Intimidate, and its pivoting moves. This makes Incineroar strongest when it can switch in and slow down threats like Sneasler and Rillaboom. When using Taunt or Will-O-Wisp, Incineroar can shut down opposing wincons like Porygon2â€™s Trick Room and Kingambit. Rage Powder from Amoonguss makes it easier for Incineroar to pivot in and out.
  • Incineroar is strong throughout the entire game; it's usually preserved throughout the game, as even switching it in is impactful, and a late-game Fake Out can be crucial regardless of how injured Incineroar is. Incineroar is notably strongest as a lead where it can threaten Fake Out and weaken opposing threats without risking any damage. Against Annihilape and Kingambit however, Incineroar likes to be paired with pieces that force them out before coming in, such as Gholdengo and Ursaluna. Assault Vest Incineroar can afford to stay in and do invaluable damage as an offensive piece occasionally, though it notably has to be a lot more careful against Amoonguss.
  • Incineroarâ€™s biggest weaknesses are Annihilape and Kingambit, as they take advantage of Intimidate and can prove to be dangerous wincons with support. Pelipper and Ursaluna-B also prove troublesome, (AC) as they are powerful attackers unaffected by Intimidate. Incineroar relies on teammates such as the aforementioned Gholdengo and Ursaluna to handle these threats along with Fake Out support. When Incineroar pivots in, it can also lead to a loss of momentum against setup Pokemon that canâ€™t be flinched with Fake Out, such as Bulk Up Annihilape, Nasty Plot Gholdengo, and Substitute Ursaluna, so it must be careful when pivoting. Bulky support Incineroarâ€™s damage output can often feel underwhelming, especially against opposing Incineroar. Assault Vest Incineroar has a tougher time providing support, notably having more trouble getting setup sweepers into position, since it lacks Parting Shot. This can make the mirror matchup tougher, as opposing Incineroar can position their threatening allies better.

Bulky Support.description:
• Incineroar excels as a support Pokemon and pivot thanks to its vast supportive movepool, Intimidate, and great typing, providing Incineroar with resistances to Gholdengoâ€™s, Rillaboomâ€™s, and Kingambitâ€™s STAB moves.
  • Incineroar can utilize Taunt over Flare Blitz to shut down support Pokemon like Amoonguss and Trick Room from Porygon2. Incineroar can also use Will-O-Wisp over Flare Blitz to weaken physical attackers like Garchomp and especially Kingambit, which punishes Intimidate.
  • Safety Goggles is preferred, so Incineroar can reliably check and ignore Amoonguss. Sitrus Berryâ€™s burst healing helps Incineroar avoid 2HKOs from attacks like Choice Specs Gholdengoâ€™s Make it Rain and Pelipperâ€™s Weather Ball after Terastallization.
  • Tera Ghost is preferred to grant Incineroar an immunity to Sneaslerâ€™s Close Combat and Dragoniteâ€™s Extreme Speed as well as a crucial immunity to Fake Out from opposing Incineroar and Rillaboom. Tera Grass can be used instead to grant Incineroar resistances to Water- and Ground-type moves such as Basculegionâ€™s Wave Crash and Garchompâ€™s Stomping Tantrum. Tera Grass also provides an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder from Amoonguss if Safety Goggles have been removed with Knock Off or Incineroar is using Sitrus Berry.
  • The defensive EVs allow Incineroar to survive Garchompâ€™s Life Orb-boosted Stomping Tantrum and, after using Tera Ghost, Gholdengoâ€™s Life Orb-boosted Shadow Ball and Choice Band Basculegionâ€™s 100-Base Power Last Respects after Intimidate.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest Incineroar is a fantastic pivot thanks to its exceptional defenses and access to Fake Out. The extra bulk enables Incineroar to play more offensively with respectable Attack and Speed investment.
  • Assault Vest helps Incineroar take attacks from Pelipper, Ursaluna-B, and Archaludon.
  • Tera Grass is preferred due to the Spore and Rage Powder immunity on top of the valuable resistances to Ground- and Water-type moves, such as Basculegionâ€™s Wave Crash and Garchompâ€™s Stomping Tantrum.
  • The Attack EVs allow Incineroar to almost always 2HKO Kingambit with Flare Blitz after Intimidate. The defensive investment ensures that Incineroar takes Annihilapeâ€™s +1 Drain Punch and avoids the 2HKO from Choice Scarf Hisuian Typhlosionâ€™s Heat Wave after Terastallization. The Speed EVs enable Incineroar to outspeed Sneasler under Tailwind.
  • Bulky support Incineroar is more flexible and can use Parting Shot as its pivot move of choice. Assault Vest Incineroar trades this flexibility in exchange for vastly more special bulk and offensive prowess. Bulky support Incineroar doesnâ€™t have to burn Terastallization to handle Amoonguss and can use Tera Ghost instead.

Assault Vest Pivot.description:
• Assault Vest makes Incineroar even bulkier at the cost of utility in not running Parting Shot or Safety Goggles.

  • The given EV spread allows Incineroar to avoid the 2HKO from Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Moonblast and take Landorus's Earth Power, while the Defense EVs let Incineroar survive Close Combat from the Urshifu formes with Sword of Ruin active.

  • Tera Grass is preferred because it flips Incineroar's weaknesses and allows it to be a consistent Amoonguss answer, ignoring Spore and Rage Powder. Incineroar can also use Tera Fairy as a more all-round defensive typing and as a way to check Urshifu-S.

Primarina.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Primarina fits well on balance teams, as it benefits from utility moves like Fake Out, healing, and redirection support that allow it to attack freely while other Pokemon cover its weaknesses.
  • Primarina synergizes well with Sneasler, as Sneasler covers its Grass-type weakness. Additionally, Rillaboom offers Fake Out utility and passive Grassy Terrain recovery, benefiting a bulkier attacker like Primarina.
  • Electabuzz is an effective redirector, shielding Primarina from threats like Archaludon and Sneasler while also redirecting Spores from Amoonguss thanks to its Vital Spirit ability and providing speed control with Electroweb. Similarly, Magmar makes a great partner with its access to Vital Spirit and Follow Me. In addition, Magmar resists Rillaboom's Grass-type attacks and can use Will-O-Wisp to compensate for Primarinaâ€™s lower physical bulk.
  • Though Primarina sits in an awkward Speed tier, it can operate on teams with a Trick Room mode such as compositions with Porygon2 and Ursaluna.
  • Kingambit is a strong offensive partner for Primarina. With Primarina's chip damage, Kingambit can more easily secure KOs with Sucker Punch. Additionally, most Kingambit sets include Swords Dance, allowing it to punish passive plays and forcing the opponent to choose between Primarina or Kingambit to target.
  • Gholdengo is another common partner for Primarina, as they effectively cover each other's weaknesses. Primarina threatens Pokemon like Incineroar and Garchomp, which can beat Gholdengo, while Gholdengo walls and pressures threats like Sneasler, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss.

Strategy Comments

  • As a slower-paced offensive piece, Primarina excels when it's positioned to safely chip away at opponents. For instance, being alongside a redirection Pokemon allows it to unleash substantial chip damage with Hyper Voice. Due to its respectable bulk, Primarina can often continue using Hyper Voice until a PokÃ©mon that poses a significant immediate threat, such as Rillaboom, enters the field.
  • The strategy with Primarina is to wait for the opportunity to establish a strong offensive position. Typically, this involves pivoting it around until it can come in and clean up effectively mid- or late-game.
  • As mentioned earlier, Rillaboom and Archaludon are significant threats; however, Sneasler effectively counters both. When facing opposing Sneasler or setup sweepers like Gholdengo or Volcarona, it's crucial to position Primarina correctlyâ€”either by placing it next to a redirector, so it can attack freely, or by utilizing other Pokemon to apply more immediate pressure. This is because Primarina is most effective when its consistent spread chip damage is sufficient to prevent it from being outpaced on offense.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Primarina excels at dealing consistent damage and wearing down opposing Pokemon. Its strong offensive typing, high Special Attack, and ability to take advantage of STAB Hyper Voice with Liquid Voice make it a formidable threat. Additionally, it puts pressure on common metagame Pokemon like Incineroar and Garchomp.
  • Haze prevents setup PokÃ©mon from exploiting Primarina's slower offensive pace. More importantly, it's often used to counter the Dondozo and Tatsugiri matchup.
  • While Throat Spray provides a power boost after using Hyper Voice, Life Orb offers more immediate damage, making it better suited for more aggressive teams. For example, Life Orb guarantees an OHKO on Hisuian Typhlosion with Hyper Voice while allowing Primarina to 2HKO Sneasler and Choice Specs Gholdengo with Hyper Voice. Sitrus Berry, on the other hand, enables Primarina to take on a more passive role, consistently enhancing its survivability. For instance, Sitrus Berry's recovery enables it to live two Stomping Tantrums from Life Orb Garchomp.
  • Tera Poison allows Primarina to resist both of Sneasler's STAB moves and, unlike the other two recommended Tera types, doesn't introduce many common weaknesses. Tera Steel gives Primarina an immunity to Poison-type moves like Sneasler's Dire Claw and a resistance to Steel-type attacks, making it particularly effective against Gholdengo's Make it Rain. Tera Grass, like Tera Poison and Tera Steel, offers a resistance to Grass-type moves from Pokemon like Rillaboom. It also provides a resistance to Electric-type attacks like Electro Shot from Archaludon, and an immunity to Spore, preventing Amoonguss from shutting it down.
  • With the given Defense and HP investment, Primarina is guaranteed to survive Grassy Glide from maximum Attack Rillaboom and a 100-Base Power Last Respects from non-Adaptability Choice Band Basculegion. The Special Defense investment ensures it can withstand Tera Steel Make it Rain from Choice Specs Gholdengo, Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, and two Freeze-Dry hits from Alolan Ninetales. The Special Attack investment gives Primarina a good chance to OHKO Garchomp with Moonblast and non-bulky Talonflame with Hyper Voice, while the Speed investment is designed to outspeed maximum Speed Maushold in Tailwind.

Kommo-o.overview:
• Kommo-o is a strong setup sweeper thanks to its excellent defensive stats and access to STAB Body Press. Its defensive typing gives it critical resistances to the signature moves of both Urshifu formes, which ignore the Defense boosts from Iron Defense. With proper support, Kommo-o is capable of becoming extremely difficult to remove once it starts setting up Iron Defense, making it an extremely effective sweeper.

  • Kommo-o appreciates teammates that help it set up more easily. Incineroar and Amoonguss are great at this, with Incineroar being able to cycle Fake Out and Parting Shot, while Amoonguss provides Spore as well as redirection support. Both give Kommo-o turns to set up and more room to maneuver, and they also have strong defensive synergy with Kommo-o. Ting-Lu is another great partner, as it can whittle down foes with Ruination, and its ability Vessel of Ruin makes Kommo-o harder to remove.

  • Ironically, one of Kommo-o's biggest weaknesses is its typing. While its numerous resistances are valuable, namely into the Ogerpon and Urshifu formes, in exchange, it is weak to a whole host of common offensive types. Strong attackers such as Flutter Mane, Raging Bolt, and Chien-Pao hit Kommo-o for super effective damage, with the former two being special attackers and the latter using Sacred Sword, meaning they all ignore Iron Defense boosts. Kommo-o is often forced to Terastallize, and requires careful positioning around threats to conserve its HP for a late game sweep.

Iron Defense Sweeper.description:
• Iron Head is used to hit Flutter Mane, which is immune to Body Press.

  • Leftovers is used for extra recovery, since Kommo-o will be on the field for long periods of time.

  • Overcoat is picked for an immunity to powder moves, allowing it to ignore Amoonguss, which can otherwise redirect a resisted Body Press and slow it down with Spore.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Kommo-o to live a Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B and makes Shadow Ball from Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane a 3HKO. On the physical side, the Defense investment allows Kommo-o to comfortably live Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash, as well as making Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow a 3HKO after Terastallizing into Steel. The Attack investment gives the best chance for an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Iron Head after Terastallizing into Steel.

  • Tera Steel has the best synergy with Kommo-o's original typing since it provides resistances to every type that Kommo-o is weak to. It also gives STAB to Iron Head, allowing for a favorable roll to OHKO Flutter Mane

Rillaboom.overview:
• Rillaboom maintains its status as a premier Fake Out pivot thanks to U-turn, Grassy Glide, and Grassy Terrain. Rillaboom fits on many archetypes and has a wide range of playstyles. Rillaboom is a great counter to Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W, as it is able to switch into their attacks and pressure them for huge damage if not a KO.

  • Assault Vest Rillaboom is the most common set currently, as it checks Flutter Mane, and can switch in on special threats and threaten with Fake Out or Grassy Glide.

  • Common Rillaboom partners include Urshifu-R and Incineroar to complete the Fire / Water / Grass core, and more offensive sets pair well with Entei and Chien-Pao with priority spam. Other great partners are defensive Pokemon such as Calm Mind Raging Bolt that benefit from Grassy Terrain recovery and Fake Out.

  • Common Rillaboom checks include Fire-types, Intimidate Pokemon to greatly reduce Rillaboom's damage output, and Pokemon that resist Grass. This includes Entei, Dragonite, and especially Incineroar.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Rillaboom is generally restricted to Fake Out, Wood Hammer, and Grassy Glide, with the 4th move usually being U-turn to pivot and sometimes High Horsepower to check Fire- and Steel-types, that would otherwise completely wall Rillaboom.

  • Rillaboom may run Tera Grass to boost its already high levels of damage, or Tera Fire to stay in on common threats such as Incineroar and Chien-Pao and U-turn out to safely bring in a frailer Pokemon.

  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to almost always survive Entei's Sacred Fire and avoid the 2HKO from Protosythesis-boosted Flutter Mane's Moonblast while retaliating with a OHKO. Thanks to its priority moves, Rillaboom can afford to not invest in Speed.

Offensive Nuke.description:
• Maximum Attack along with Tera Grass allows Rillaboom to always KO Flutter Mane with Sword of Ruin-boosted Grassy Glide. Protect is favored as the last move, as Rillaboom loses a lot of the bulk from the Assault Vest.

  • This set generally looks for all-or-nothing plays, picking up OHKOs against common tanks such as Iron Hands, Farigiraf, and Ogerpon-W with Wood Hammer, and picking up KOs on frailer pokemon with Grassy Glide.

  • This set can struggle against Intimidate, especially Incineroar, as the sudden drop to its Attack can severely minimize the absurdity of Rillaboom's attacks, allowing bulkier Pokemon to survive a boosted Wood Hammer.

  • The EV spread allows Rillaboom to survive Tera Stellar Ice Spinner from Chien-Pao at -1 and almost always take Fairy Feather Tera Fairy Flutter Mane's Moonblast. Rillaboom can afford to forgo Speed investment, as it already outspeeds common slow Pokemon like Farigiraf and Incineroar.

Hatterene.overview:
• Wielding the highest Special Attack of any Pokemon to get Expanding Force and Speed lower than even Amoonguss, Hatterene is the poster child for Trick Room variants of Psychic-type spam teams. It deals with many of the usual Trick Room answers, including Iron Hands and Amoonguss, even being immune to the latter's Spore due to Magic Bounce. Magic Bounce also prevents potential Taunt users from shutting down Trick Room.

  • Hatterene requires two things to succeed; Trick Room and Psychic Terrain. Indeedee-F provides both with Psychic Surge, Trick Room, and Follow Me to help Hatterene set up its own Trick Room. It is nearly impossible to deny Trick Room against a lead of Hatterene and Indeedee-F. Torkoal and Ursaluna deal with Steel-types that resist both of Hatterene's STAB moves, and they also benefit from Trick Room.

  • Aforementioned Steel-types like Gholdengo are tougher to break through for Hatterene, as well as Dark-types that take neutral damage from Dazzling Gleam, such as Incineroar, Kingambit, and Chi-Yu, the latter of which has Snarl to lower Hatterene's damage output. Assault Vest Raging Bolt running Snarl also slows Hatterene down, despite being weak to Dazzling Gleam. Rillaboom changing the terrain, weakening Expanding Force greatly, and allowing priority moves to go through can also be a huge blow to a gameplan involving Hatterene.

  • Lastly, like most Trick Room sweepers, Hatterene is susceptible to Trick Room either being denied or fully stalled out, leaving it defenseless.

Bulky Life Orb Attacker.description:
• Tera Psychic boosts Hatterene's damage output to scary levels, allowing it to OHKO Ursaluna-B and have a favorable roll to OHKO bulky Flutter Mane. Alternatively, Tera Fire is a great defensive typing against the Flutter Mane and Chi-Yu combination, as well as Gholdengo.

  • 212 HP EVs minimize Life Orb recoil, and 100 Defense EVs alongside them allow Hatterene to always survive Adamant Tera Dark Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow. The rest of the EVs are invested in Special Attack to maximize damage output, and a Quiet nature + 0 Speed IVs ensures you move before minimum Speed Amoonguss in Trick Room.

Indeedee-F.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Indeedee-F works best on dedicated Trick Room teams, using Follow Me to almost always guarantee its partner to set up Trick Room as well as pairing well with Trick Room sweepers. It sets up Psychic Terrain to prevent Fake Out from disturbing your team's Trick Room setup as well as preventing priority attacks from threatening its partners.

  • Ursaluna and Ursaluna-B are common partners for Indeedee-F. Trick Room can help with the speed control both Ursaluna formes need, and Follow Me can protect them from non-spread moves while allowing them to deal Normal-type damage with Blood Moon and Facade and Ground-type damage with Headlong Rush, Earthquake, and Earth Power. Other Trick Room sweepers, such as Hatterene and Torkoal, are the best Trick Room partners for Indeedee-F. Hatterene can threaten the opponent's team with heavy Psychic-type damage from Expanding Force, and Torkoal can threaten heavy Fire-type damage with Eruption, Weather Ball, and Heat Wave. Gallade can threaten Dark-type Pokemon with Sacred Sword and provide Wide Guard support to protect its side of the field from spread moves. Sneasler pairs nicely with Indeedee-F because Sneasler can hold the Psychic Seed, activating its Unburden ability.

  • Kingambit will decimate any opposing Indeedee-F. Even if Indeedee-F Terastallizes into a Fairy-type, Kingambit will still do significant amount of damage to it. Therefore, a Fighting-type Pokemon like Sneasler should be used to threaten Kingambit, as it can almost always guarantee a OHKO on Kingambit with Close Combat. Rillaboom is another threat to watch out for, as it can set up Grassy Terrain, which can override the Psychic Terrain that Indeedee-F sets up.

Strategy Comments

  • Indeedee-F is a support Pokemon. It redirects attacks with Follow Me, provides speed control with Trick Room, provides important chip damage with Psychic or Dazzling Gleam, and helps partners spam Expanding Force.

  • Indeedee-F is best used early-game. As a lead, it is really good to get a head start at initializing your strategy. Sneasler, Ursaluna-B , and Ursaluna are all common Pokemon to lead alongside Indeedee-F. The Sneasler + Indeedee-F lead doesn't require Trick Room to be utilized and does not require any other setup. The Ursaluna-B + Indeedee-F lead does not have to be in Trick Room, depending on the Speed investment of Ursaluna-B, and it unleashes some of the largest amount of special damage in the metagame. Ursaluna and Indeedee-F have to be in Trick Room and need Ursaluna's Guts boost to be utilized thoroughly. However, this lead provides some of the largest amount of physical damage in the metagame.

  • The biggest weakness Indeedee-F has to deal with is the move Taunt. Taunt prevents Indeedee-F from setting up Trick Room and doing its job as a supportive Pokemon. The most reliable way to get rid of Taunt is to switch Indeedee-F out. Sometimes, Indeedee-F has to rely on its ally to set up Trick Room instead. Because it is a Trick Room Pokemon, it is vulnerable to being double targeted, which prevents Trick Room from being set up. Fortunately, it has Follow Me, which can redirect non-spread moves to it, allowing its ally to set up Trick Room.

Bulky Support.description:
• Indeedee-F is a support Pokemon that mainly redirects attacks with Follow Me and sets up Trick Room. The Psychic Terrain that it sets up supports its teammates by protecting them from opposing priority moves like Sucker Punch and Fake Out.

  • Follow Me provides redirection so that an allied Pokemon can safely set up Tailwind or Trick Room or set up with moves such as Annihilape's Bulk Up, Kingambit's Swords Dance, and Kommo-o's Clangorous Soul. Imprison prevents Trick Room from being set up by foes and shuts down the opponent's Follow Me Pokemon. Dazzling Gleam is mainly used to break opposing Pokemon that hold Focus Sash.

  • Safety Goggles provides immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and Rage Powder while allowing Indeedee-F to use Follow Me to redirect Spore. Psychic Seed ensures that it takes attacks like Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon better. Rocky Helmet punishes any Pokemon that attack it with contact-making moves or have said attacks redirected to it. Some of these contact moves are Annihilape's Drain Punch and Rage Fist, Rillaboom's Wood Hammer, and Sneasler's Dire Claw and Close Combat. Rocky Helmet also has the ability to break Focus Sashes and threaten any Pokemon that use multi-hit moves, such as Maushold and its Population Bomb. Sitrus Berry helps out Indeedee-F's longevity by allowing it to survive moves like +4 Archaludon's Body Press and Pelipper's Weather Ball.

  • Fairy is the best Tera type for Indeedee-F. It provides resistances to Kingambit's Kowtow Cleave and Sucker Punch, Archaludon's Body Press, and Sneasler's Close Combat and Throat Chop and an immunity to Dragon-type moves from Archaludon, Dragonite, Garchomp, and Dragapult. As a little bonus, it offers a STAB boost to Dazzling Gleam. Tera Grass gives Indeedee-F a resistance to Grass-type moves such as Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Water-type moves such as Basculegion-M's Wave Crash and Pelipper's rain-boosted Weather Ball, which are its partners' most common weaknesses. Tera Grass also provides immunity to Amoonguss's Spore and redirection. However, if Indeedee-F uses Safety Goggles, Tera Grass is not recommended.

Dragapult.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Dragapult is a common attacker on balance teams with bulky redirectors, such as Electabuzz, Magmar, and Clefable. Redirectors are vital, since they assist in keeping Dragapult around for longer, which is especially important because Dragapult is frail and is weak to Sucker Punch from threats such as Kingambit. Additionally, Dragapult appreciates Fake Out support from the likes of Rillaboom, as it gives free turns for Dragapult to get extra attacks off, and it works nicely with Phantom Force, preventing a foe from attacking Dragapult after it lands the attack.
  • Dragapult appreciates partners that can cover its weaknesses offensively or that can reliably switch into its checks; some examples are Sneasler and Primarina. Sneasler is a fast attacker that can outspeed and threaten Dark- and Fairy-types such as Incineroar, Kingambit, and Primarina. Primarina is a slower, bulkier attacker that can switch into attacks easier while still having the ability to OHKO threats such as Incineroar.
  • Dark-types such as Kingambit and Incineroar are the biggest checks to Dragapult, as they can easily shrug off its attacks and threaten it with an OHKO. The aforementioned partners can help against these threats by threatening them and redirecting attacks, buying more time for Dragapult to switch out safely or overwhelm them with strong Dragon-type attacks. Tailwind teams can also be a big problem to Dragapult, as it relies on being faster than its foes and getting lots of damage off before they can move. Partners such as Rillaboom and Kingambit can help against Tailwind teams, since they can attack foes with strong priority moves, stall turns with smart pivoting, and, in Rillaboom's case, use Fake Out.

Strategy Comments

  • Dragapult is a sweeper, and it requires a lot of smart positioning to use it to its maximum potential. Dragapult shines in positions where its partners can support it either offensively by threatening its checks or defensively by aiding in its longevity. U-turn is a great tool in this regard, as it allows Dragapult to escape from tricky positions while doing chip damage to a foe.
  • Dragapult utilizes Terastallization to get major damage on enemy Pokemon throughout the course of the game. Dragapult can be utilized early-game to get off powerful Tera Dragon Dragon Darts or Tera Blast Ghost, or it can be utilized late-game to clean the enemy team with Dragon Darts and Phantom Force.
  • Dragapult's biggest weakness is Pokemon that resist its STAB attacks, such as Kingambit, Alolan Ninetales, and Incineroar. Dragapult utilizes its partners to help against these threats until they are weakened to a point where Dragapult can finish them off. Priority attacks such as Sucker Punch from Kingambit and forms of speed control, such as Tailwind and Trick Room, are threatening to Dragapult, as it is frail and relies on its high damage output and outspeeding foes. Against priority attacks, Dragapult pivots partners in or utilizes an ally with redirection to take the attacks for it. Against Tailwind and Trick Room teams, Dragapult again uses smart pivots and defensive tools such as Follow Me and Fake Out to stall out turns of Trick Room, allowing it to clean up late-game.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Dragapult uses its powerful STAB attacks, phenomenal Speed, and solid Attack stat to outrun almost every Pokemon in the game and deal massive damage to the opposing team.
  • Dragon Darts is great at consistently chipping down the opposing team. Phantom Force is Dragapult's strongest Ghost-type STAB move that can also shatter Protect, but it allows foes to switch due to its charging turn. Tera Dragon sets prefer Outrage to nuke foes, albeit inconsistently. On the other hand, Tera Blast Ghost is a reliable one-turn Ghost-type STAB move. U-turn allows Dragapult to get chip damage on foes and pivot out of tricky matchups while dealing respectable damage to threats such as Rillaboom.
  • Choice Band boosts Dragapult's Attack stat to great levels, which pairs excellently with its high Speed.
  • Tera Dragon allows Dragapult to OHKO Garchomp and Hydreigon with one hit from Dragon Darts and Incineroar, Electabuzz, and Magmar with Outrage. Additionally, Tera Dragon removes Dragapult's weakness to Sucker Punch from Kingambit. Tera Ghost is used, since it gives Dragapult a consistent physical Ghost-type attack in Tera Blast Ghost while also allowing it to OHKO Volcarona and Primarina with Phantom Force.
  • An Adamant nature allows Dragapult to always OHKO Volcarona with Outrage and almost always OHKO a Terastallized Hisuian Typhlosion with Phantom Force. A Jolly nature allows Dragapult to outspeed Jolly Talonflame, Adamant Choice Scarf Basculegion-M, and opposing Adamant Dragapult.

Urshifu.overview:
• Urshifu-S is capable of dealing massive damage with its signature move Wicked Blow and high base Attack, as well as its amazing ability in Unseen Fist, which allows it to bypass Protect and apply constant pressure.

  • Tornadus is a great partner for Urshifu-S, as it provides speed control with Tailwind and can launch powerful Bleakwind Storms into Fighting-types like Urshifu-R that resist Wicked Blow. Many of Urshifu-S's threats, such as Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane, and Urshifu-R naturally outspeed it, so strong speed control is vital. Ogerpon-W can Terastallize to better handle a lot of threats to Urshifu-S such as Chien-Pao, Flutter Mane. and Landorus, and support it with Follow Me. Rillaboom hits most Dark-resistant foes such as Iron Hands and Urshifu-R for high damage, and can support it with Fake Out and priority Grass Glide, which combined with a Sucker Punch from Urshifu-S can OHKO Flutter Mane. In return, Urshifu-S handles Rillaboom's weaknesses, hitting the plethora of Steel- and Dark-types that resist its Grass-type STAB moves such as Kingambit, Incineroar, and Gholdengo.

  • Urshifu-S struggles to break through teams with strong Dark-resistant Pokemon or generally bulky supports like Urshifu-R, Iron Hands, and Tera Fairy Flutter Mane as well as redirection from Amoonguss and Fake Out from Incineroar. Due to its poor defensive typing, middling Speed and lack of coverage, it faces issues against faster teams and its many checks.

Focus Sash.description:
• Close Combat hits common Dark-resistant Pokemon such as Incineroar and Kingambit. Sucker Punch provides priority and makes up for Urshifu-S's average Speed tier.

  • Urshifu-S uses Tera Dark to fire off strong Wicked Blows or Tera Stellar to boost the damage output of its STAB moves. Tera-boosted Close Combat OHKOes common Incineroar at -1 Attack, and both Tera types will allow Urshifu-S to OHKO Flutter Mane, provided its boost is still intact for Dark-type moves.

  • Focus Sash allows Urshifu-S to survive any one attack, making up for its poor defensive typing. In contrast to Choice items, it gives Urshifu-S the freedom to switch moves and use Detect when threatened, which is especially strong against Fake Out leads.

  • The extra EVs in Defense are to maximize Urshifu-S's chance of surviving a use of Surging Strikes from Tera Water Mystic Water Urshifu-R.

Choice Band.description:
• Choice Band is used to guarantee an OHKO on common targets like Landorus, Ogerpon-H, Flutter Mane, and even Tornadus that are not invested heavily in physical bulk. Even naturally bulky Pokemon such as Dragonite and Walking Wake can be OHKOed or put in the range for minimal damage to KO them.

  • Poison Jab is excellent coverage, hitting the problematic Fairy-types that Urshifu-S normally struggles with. After Terastallization, you can guarantee an OHKO on almost all Rillaboom, Terastallized Flutter mane, and even bulkier pokemon like Tera Fairy Indeedee-F. U-turn is also a viable move as a pivot option.

  • The Attack investment and Adamant nature are necessary to get the KOs mentioned earlier, such as the OHKO on Landorus and Tornadus. The Defense investment allows Urshifu-S to survive the combination of Tera Normal Choice Band Dragonite's Extreme Speed and Sucker Punch from Adamant Chien-Pao. The Special Defense EVs allow Urshifu-S to take a variety of strong attacks such as Earth Power from Landorus and Bleakwind Storm from Tornadus. The remaining EVs are placed in Speed.

  • Tera Poison is chosen to resist the Fighting- and Fairy-type moves that would otherwise hit Urshifu-S super effectively. Urshifu-S is naturally immune to Psychic and has Dark-type moves to cover for the weakness, and it also naturally threatens Psychic-types like Farigiraf. Tera Dark is also an option, as the extra damage combined with Choice Band is absurd and, combined with good Tailwind support and redirection, is a good choice. However, it requires more careful positioning around threats, as Urshifu-S won't be able to Terastallize out of it's Fairy- and Fighting-type weaknesses.

Urshifu-Rapid-Strike.overview:
• Urshifu-R is one of the most oppressive Pokemon in the game format due to its high Attack stat, powerful Surging Strikes, and Unseen Fist ability, which allows it to completely ignore Protect. Furthermore, its strong matchups against metagame staples Incineroar, Chien-Pao, and Landorus add to its viability.

  • Urshifu-R is commonly paired with Tornadus, which provides it with Prankster Tailwind support, allowing it to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame; Tornadus also beats Urshifu-R's few checks, such as Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss. Chien-Pao is another common partner, decreasing foes' Defense with Sword of Ruin and checking Amoonguss and Tornadus; Urshifu-R, in return, helps Chien-Pao beat its checks such Entei and as the ubiquitous Incineroar. Incineroar and Rillaboom also make for excellent partners for Urshifu-R, as the trio forms a fundamentally strong Fire-Water-Grass Fire / Water / Grass core, covering each other's weaknesses.

  • Due to all of its strong points, Urshifu-R always has a big target on its back, notably being checked by Pokemon such as Rocky Helmet Amoonguss and Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane, which is commonly utilized on Tailwind teams, as it can outspeed and OHKO Urshifu-R if it does not Terastallize. Raging Bolt and Rillaboom also immensely pressure Urshifu-R with their priority moves in Thunderclap and Grassy Glide, the former of which may even OHKO Urshifu-R depending on Raging Bolt's Special Attack investment. Rillaboom can also disrupt Urshifu-R and its teammates with Fake Out. Iron Hands comfortably takes even Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes and can potentially OHKO Urshifu-R back with Wild Charge, so players should be careful to position Urshifu-R into safe and advantageous situations.

Choice Scarf.description:
• U-turn allows Urshifu-R to hit Ogerpon-W hard, get around Amoonguss, and pivot between its teammates like Incineroar and Rillaboom. Aqua Jet is a good option to revenge kill weakened Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane and Sucker Punch Chien-Pao, as well as a way to get around Raging Bolt's Thunderclap. Ice Spinner can be utilized to remove Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain and Indeedee's Psychic Terrain. It also provides Urshifu-R with a way to hit Amoonguss.

  • Choice Scarf lets Urshifu-R get the jump on and threaten an OHKO with Surging Strikes against Pokemon it normally cannot outrun, such as Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Choice Scarf Landorus-T. As an added bonus, Choice Scarf also allows it to outspeed Dragapult.

  • The Special Defense investment lets Urshifu-R always survive a maximum Special Attack Iron Bundle Freeze-Dry and, when Terastallized, a Choice Specs Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The Defense EVs allow Urshifu-R to withstand a Choice Band- and Tera Normal-boosted Extreme Speed from maximum Attack Tera Normal Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active.

  • Urshifu-R is a great beneficiary of Terastallization, as Tera Water allows it to 2HKO almost the entire unresisted metagame while simultaneity getting rid of its Fairy and Flying weaknesses. Urshifu-R can also opt for Tera Poison or Grass, providing a resistance to Rillaboom's Grassy Glide and resistances to Flutter Mane and Raging Bolt's STAB moves, respectively. The latter keeps the Flying weakness but welcomes an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder.

Mystic Water.description:
• Aqua Jet picks off weakened Flutter Mane, Chien-Pao, and Entei, which are normally faster than Urshifu-R.

  • The Defense investment helps Urshifu-R take a Choice Band, Tera Normal Dragonite Extreme Speed from maximum Attack Dragonite even with Sword of Ruin active on the battlefield, as well as a Miracle Seed Rillaboom Grassy Glide. The Special Defense EVs let Urshifu-R almost always survive Thunderclap from Raging Bolt and Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs let Urshifu-R outspeed -1 Roaring Moon and Adamant Chien-Pao.

Regidrago.overview:
*Regidrago is a great offensive Pokemon that has immense damage output and can sweep teams easily thanks to Dragon's Maw and Dragon Energy.

*When paired with Pokemon like Tornadus, the Ogerpon formes, and Indeedee that provide speed control, redirection, and priority immunity, respectively, it truly becomes difficult to hinder Regidrago's damage output. Gholdengo is one of its best partners, as it can effectively remove Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao, which are major threats for Regidrago.

*Regidrago cannot damage the most influential Pokemon of the format â€” Flutter Maneâ€”with its STAB moves. Its middling Speed makes it vulnerable to faster threats, though with the right support that ensures that all the Fairy-, Steel-types, and common Focus Sash users like Chien-Pao are checked, it can absolutely steamroll teams.

Dragon Fang.description:
*Draco Meteor allows Regidrago to pick OHKOs when Dragon Energy isn't dealing much damage at low HP, and Earth Power allows it to damage to Steel types like Gholdengo and Kingambit.

*Regidrago boosts its damage output with Dragon Fang that stacks on Dragon Maw and does insane damage.

*Tera Steel is a great defensive Tera that allows it to resist its original weaknesses.

Ursaluna.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Ursaluna mandates Trick Room support, as without it, it is very vulnerable to the vast majority of attackers, which are faster than it. Therefore, tactics that virtually guarantee that Trick Room gets set up are good for Ursaluna teams. Redirection also enables Ursaluna to throw out its powerful attacks.
  • Porygon2 is an excellent partner to Ursaluna, as it can leverage its bulk and Recover to set up Trick Room multiple times in a battle; this lets Ursaluna be a threat throughout the game. It also provides special offense to complement Ursaluna's physical offense. Incineroar is great with Porygon2, as its Fake Out makes it easier for Porygon2 to set up Trick Room, which benefits Ursaluna because it wants Trick Room to be set up. Incineroar can also safely bring in Ursaluna with Parting Shot or U-turn.
  • Ursaluna also fits on Psychic-type spam teams. These teams use Indeedee-F, which has both Follow Me and Trick Room, to enable attackers that can also set up Trick Room like Hatterene and Armarouge. Not only do these teams reliably set up Trick Room, but they also provide powerful special offense to pair with Ursaluna's powerful physical offense.
  • Gholdengo is a common sight on Ursaluna teams, as it handles Archaludon and Fighting-types that scare Ursaluna. Amoonguss fits well on Trick Room teams, as its Rage Powder lets Porygon2 set up Trick Room and Ursaluna attack more freely, and its Spore lets it shut down one foe so that the Ursaluna can target the other more freely. Amoonguss also supports Ursaluna by extending its longevity with Pollen Puff.

Strategy Comments

  • Ursaluna is a Trick Room sweeper, and it wants to be positioned on the field such that it can throw out its attacks with as many turns of Trick Room as possible. Getting Trick Room up is a major priority for Ursaluna's teams, so tactics that disrupt this, including Fake Out, Taunt, Imprison, and Trick Room, give more room to deal with the mighty bear.
  • Ursaluna is not concerned with the battle state as long as Trick Room is set; if it is, then Ursaluna provides the most value when using with Facade or Headlong Rush. However, Ursaluna itself doesn't help its partner set up Trick Room, so it is less advisable to lead Ursaluna if the opposing team has the means to disrupt Trick Room. Despite this, Ursaluna wants to enter the battle with as many turns of Trick Room as possible, so aggressive switching or switch moves can be utilized to maximize Ursaluna's threat potential.
  • Rain teams threaten to overwhelm Ursaluna with their boosted Water-type attacks, so weather of its own from the likes of Torkoal and Tyranitar is very useful; alternatively, if Trick Room is set up, Ursaluna can simply run them over itself. Grassy Glide from Rillaboom bypasses Trick Room and threatens Ursaluna greatly; Terrain support or redirection from Indeedee-F neutralizes this threat. Intimidate cycling will weaken Ursaluna greatly, but if it is behind a Substitute, it does not need to fear it. Fighting-types like Sneasler and Gallade are problematic for Ursaluna, but redirection from the likes of Amoonguss and Terastallizing Ghost can mitigate them. Corviknight completely walls Ursaluna's STAB moves, so Ursaluna is reliant on teammates to weaken Corviknight so that it can be dealt with. Certain Pokemon such as Torkoal and Hatterene move before Ursaluna in Trick Room, so they can push damage into Ursaluna before it can respond; however, these are usually only seen on opposing Trick Room teams.

Guts.description:
• Ursaluna is a destructively powerful Trick Room attacker that doesn't fear Amoonguss's Spore. It takes advantage of Guts, Flame Orb, and Facade to delete bulky foes like Garchomp, Rillaboom, and Hatterene.
  • Earthquake is a powerful spread move that threatens both foes, bypassing redirection, but it requires teammates to either be immune to Ground or use Protect in order for it to be used safely. Meanwhile, Substitute takes advantage of foes that try and use Protect to passively let Ursaluna wear itself out with burn chip damage and stall out Trick Room turns; it will also block Intimidate once it has been set up.
  • Flame Orb activates Guts and boosts the power of Facade. One side benefit of getting burned is that Ursaluna won't be put to sleep by Amoonguss's Spore and Vivillon's Sleep Powder.
  • Tera Ghost allows Ursaluna to become immune to Fighting-type attacks and Fake Out; the latter is important because it would otherwise deny Ursaluna from attacking in Trick Room. Tera Fairy also sheds Ursaluna's weakness to Fighting while letting it beat Dragon-types like Dragapult and Archaludon. Tera Normal powers up Facade even further, allowing it to turn 2HKOs or unfavorable OHKO chances on the likes of Amoonguss, Electabuzz, Clefable, Ursaluna, and Ursaluna-B into guaranteed OHKOs.
  • The given EV spread allows Ursaluna to survive a Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Blood Moon, a +1 Draco Meteor from Archaludon, or a Make it Rain from Choice Specs Gholdengo and the burn damage right after while maximizing its Attack.

Guts Attacker.description:
• Facade and Headlong Rush are used as the strongest attacks available to Ursaluna. Earthquake is used as a strong spread damage option and to bypass Follow Me from opposing Ogerpon formes. Swords Dance can also be used to punish passive play and to reverse some of the effects from Intimidate, but this forces Ursaluna to give up one of its Ground-type moves.

  • The EV spread allows Ursaluna to survive Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, Blood Moon from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, and Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-W, all after burn damage. The rest of the EVs are invested into Attack

  • Tera Ghost is used to give Ursaluna an immunity to Fighting-type attacks but more importantly Fake Out, removing a key method to stalling out Ursaluna's Trick Room turns. Tera Poison can be used for more resistances, notably improving the matchup against Rillaboom and Flutter Mane, which it normally struggles with; however, Ursaluna loses the Fake Out and Fighting immunity.

Ursaluna-Bloodmoon.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Ursaluna-B is a good piece on more offensive teams thanks to its wallbreaking ability. Its ability to break down bulky foes benefits fast cleaners like Sneasler, Choice Scarf Basculegion, and Scale Shot Dragonite.
  • Life Orb Ursaluna-B is vulnerable to faster attackers like Sneasler and Dragapult, so speed control options such as Tailwind and Trick Room ensure it can bypass them. Fake Out can create opportunities for Ursaluna-B to throw out its powerful attacks; redirection does the same. Life Orb Ursaluna-B can be revenge killed by Rillaboom's Grassy Glide, so means of blocking it like Psychic Terrain and Armor Tail are useful.
  • Sneasler is an offensive cleaner that appreciates Life Orb Ursaluna-B's ability to tear through bulky Pokemon. Dondozo paired with Tatsugiri is a similarly threatening sweeper that picks apart teams weakened by Ursaluna-B. Tailwind setters like Whimsicott and Talonflame allow Ursaluna-B to outspeed and defeat faster, frailer attackers that would otherwise threaten Ursaluna-B. Conversely, if the opposing team has Tailwind or other speed control of their own, Trick Room from the likes of Farigiraf, Indeedee-F, and Sinistcha will similarly turn the tables on that. Indeedee-M, Indeedee-F, and Farigiraf can block Fake Out and Grassy Glide, allowing Ursaluna-B to function in the face of Rillaboom. Fake Out from Incineroar, Rillaboom, and, sometimes, Sneasler gives Ursaluna-B opportunities to isolate an opposing Pokemon to attack.
  • Assault Vest Ursaluna-B is more self-sufficient because it is able to take more hits. However, its damage output is lacking compared to the Life Orb variant, so it wants more offensive teammates to supplement it. Dual screens support reinforces Ursaluna-B's bulk and lets it stick around to output damage longer. Fast sweepers can take advantage of teams that get weakened by Assault Vest Ursaluna-B.
  • Offensive Pokemon make great partners for Assault Vest Ursaluna-B, as they appreciate its ability to take hits and dish out damage in return. Gholdengo handles many of Ursaluna-B's checks like Sneasler and Rillaboom and provides a secondary check to Archaludon. Their combined special attacking output can overwhelm specially bulky foes like Assault Vest Rillaboom. Dragonite similarly takes advantage of Fighting- and Grass-types while also doing so for Water-types like Pelipper and Basculegion and uses the damage that Ursaluna-B spreads on the opposing team to clean up with Scale Shot. Alolan Ninetales cuts off Pelipper's rain, damages Water-types with Freeze-Dry, and can support Ursaluna-B with Aurora Veil, which massively boosts its already solid bulk with Assault Vest. Other dual screens setters like Grimmsnarl and Klefki can also do so, and they provide additional support in the form of Thunder Wave. Bulk Up Annihilape takes advantage of Sneasler to set up and power through the opposing team; it often gets paired with bulky Maushold, which can redirect opposing attacks away from Ursaluna-B with Follow Me, shut down Amoonguss with Taunt, and bolster Ursaluna-B's bulk with Friend Guard.

Strategy Comments

  • Ursaluna-B is mainly an early-game wallbreaker that can weaken opposing teams for its teammates to clean up. Speed control is imperative for it to achieve this function and is especially important for Life Orb Ursaluna-B because it does not have as much bulk. By contrast, Assault Vest Ursaluna-B can take hits and dish out damage, leaning into its bulk to throw out several threatening attacks instead of a few catastrophic ones.
  • Sneasler is the best check to Ursaluna-B, as it outspeeds Ursaluna-B even under Tailwind if Unburden is activated. However, it hates taking any attack, which can be facilitated by setting up Trick Room. Rain teams filled with threatening Water-types like Pelipper and Basculegion give Ursaluna-B no room to attack unless it Terastallizes Water, though doing so leaves it vulnerable to Archaludon's Electro Shot. Under Trick Room or with redirection support, however, Ursaluna-B can rip these teams apart. Assault Vest Ursaluna-B is especially vulnerable to Rillaboom, as it cannot use Protect or Terastallize to escape its Grass-type attacks. Assault Vest Pokemon like Rillaboom and Kingambit trade damage favorably into Ursaluna-B but are always vulnerable to Fake Out and redirection.

Bulky Wallbreaker.description:
• Ursaluna-B can rip apart teams with its powerful STAB attacks augmented by its ability, Mind's Eye.
  • Blood Moon is a metagame-warping move, as it will simply drop even bulky foes like Farigiraf that are unprepared for its damage. Hyper Voice puts out powerful spread damage and still heavily damages frailer foes like Hisuian Typhlosion, Whimsicott, and Sneasler; having two Normal-type STAB moves is good to have because it lets Ursaluna-B hit Ground-resistant and -immune foes even when it cannot use Blood Moon. Mind's Eye supports both of these moves, letting Ursaluna-B throw out its Normal-type attacks without fear of Ghost-types ignoring them. Life Orb sets prefer the defensive value of Protect, whereas Assault Vest sets opt for Vacuum Wave to pick off weakened foes.
  • Life Orb maximizes Ursaluna-B's damage potential, securing OHKOes on bulky foes like opposing Ursaluna-B and Hatterene with Blood Moon and Gholdengo with Earth Power. Assault Vest gives Ursaluna-B some additional special bulk to survive attacks from the format's powerful special attackers.
  • Tera Normal is used on Life Orb sets to give Blood Moon the extra power to OHKO bulky foes like Primarina and Assault Vest Rillaboom while strengthening Hyper Voice for devastating spread damage. Tera Water is preferred on Assault Vest Ursaluna-B and is used to hold off Hisuian Typhlosion, Torkoal, and Primarina.
  • 204 Speed EVs allow Ursaluna-B to outspeed Adamant Dragapult under Tailwind, though this much Speed is only run on Tailwind teams. This and maximum Special Attack investment maximize the offensive potential of Life Orb Ursaluna-B. However, with some special bulk, Assault Vest Ursaluna-B will survive otherwise devastating special attacks like Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Tera Normal Blood Moon, Choice Specs Gholdengo's Tera Steel Make It Rain, and Life Orb Hatterene's Expanding Force in Psychic Terrain; it also is favored to survive truly absurd attacks like Choice Specs Hisuian Typhlosion's Tera Fire Eruption at maximum power and can guarantee living the move with Tera Water or Vacuum Wave.

Trick Room Sweeper.description:
• Hyper Voice provides Ursaluna-B with a more spammable Normal-type STAB attack, especially during Blood Moon's cooldown.

  • Life Orb is recommended, as it provides Ursaluna-B with a boost to its attacks, and Ursaluna-B doesn't mind the recoil due to its great bulk and ability to consistently move first under Trick Room.

  • The given EV spread lets it live a Tera Fairy Moonblast from a Special Attack Booster Energy Flutter Mane. 0 Speed IVs and a Quiet nature allow it to function better under Trick Room.

  • Ursaluna-B may opt for an EV spread of 84 HP / 252 SpA / 172 Spe to outspeed Adamant Chien-Pao under Tailwind.

  • Tera Normal can be used to boost the damage output of Blood Moon and Hyper Voice to nuclear levels.

Sneasler.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Sneasler synergizes best with other strong attackers that threaten the Poison- and Ghost-type Pokemon that Sneasler struggles to hit. Focus Sash Sneasler pairs best with both special and physical attackers, while Terrain Seed Sneasler both requires either Rillaboom or an Indeedee forme as a partner and pairs very well with them. Sneasler threatens opposing Grass- and Steel-types that resist Rillaboom's Grass-type attacks and Dark- and Steel-types that can switch into Indeedee-M's Expanding Force.
  • Kingambit and Dragapult both synergize very well with Sneasler. Dragapult enjoys Sneasler threatening Primarina, which is a common switch-in to Dragapult's attacks. Dragapult is also extremely fast, letting it and Sneasler quickly overwhelm foes. Dragapult and Kingambit both benefit from Sneasler being good against opposing Kingambit, as they struggle to hit it.
  • Sneasler's main weakness is Gholdengo, since it is immune to all of Sneasler's attacks if it isn't running Throat Chop and is often paired with Incineroar, which can lower Sneasler's Attack while also switching into Throat Chop. An allied Kingambit can help with this, as it benefits from Intimidate and resists both of Gholdengo's STAB attacks while also hitting it for super effective damage.

Strategy Comments

  • Sneasler's main role is to use its good coverage against the metagame and good offensive stats to clear the way for other attackers. Look for situations where an opposing team has limited checks to an offensive Pokemon like Dragapult and attempt to remove these checks with Sneasler.
