  • Sneasler works best as an early-game attacker, as it can be lead with Pokemon with weaknesses it can cover, forcing the opponent to be weak against one or the other. Tough matchups for Sneasler can simply be resolved by not bringing it, as it shouldn't be the centerpiece of any team.
  • Sneasler's main counters are bulky Pokemon and Pokemon that it lacks the coverage to hit. Sneasler's best partners tend to have a good matchup against most Pokemon that resist its attacks in addition to covering Sneasler's type-based weaknesses as well.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Sneasler uses its high Speed and good offensive typing to do large amounts of damage to the opposing team and potentially spread status through Dire Claw and Poison Touch.
  • Focus Sash Sneasler is guaranteed to live one hit, giving it a better matchup against opposing Pokemon that outspeed and threaten to OHKO it such as Talonflame. -An Adamant nature boosts Sneasler's damage output, giving it a chance to OHKO Ursaluna, Ursaluna-B, and Archaludon. A Jolly nature allows Sneasler to outspeed Maushold and Alolan Ninetales.
  • Tera Stellar boosts all of Sneasler's attacks, letting Close Combat OHKO Incineroar after Intimidate and OHKO Archaludon. Tera Ghost gives Sneasler an immunity to Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which could break its Focus Sash. When paired with Garchomp, Sneasler can use Tera Flying in order to become immune to Earthquake while boosting Garchomp's Attack with Coaching.
  • Fake Out can help Sneasler's partners such as Kingambit and Gholdengo find a chance to set up. Coaching is a more niche option that does well when paired with multiple physical attackers, as Sneasler can use its high Speed stat to outspeed and boost partners such as Garchomp and Kingambit, allowing them to immediately fire off a boosted attack.
  • Poison Touch pairs well with Fake Out, allowing Sneasler to both prevent a foe from moving and have a chance to chip them throughout the game. Unburden is less consistent with Focus Sash than with a Terrain Seed but can work well against hyper offense teams that pair a strong attacker spamming spread moves with a priority Tailwind setter.
  • Focus Sash Sneasler can use its ability to live any hit to OHKO Pokemon like Primarina even when they are paired with a Pokemon that is faster than Sneasler like Dragapult.
  • Focus Sash Sneasler can't reliably activate Unburden, so it is slower than most Pokemon when they have Tailwind activated, which, when paired with Sneasler's poor bulk, can be a problem.

Terrain Attacker.description:
• Grassy or Psychic Seed Sneasler uses its high Speed that can be boosted by Unburden to outspeed opposing Pokemon even if they have Tailwind set up or if Sneasler's Speed has been lowered.
  • Fake Out lets Sneasler prevent a foe from attacking, potentially letting a partner, such as Kingambit or Gholdengo, get a turn to attack or set up. Throat Chop lets Sneasler hit Ghost-type Pokemon like Gholdengo and Basculegion-M for super effective damage as well as avoiding Psychic Terrain's blocking of Fake Out when Sneasler is paired with Indeedee-M.
  • Tera Stellar works better on Sneasler sets that aren't running Throat Chop or can afford it to be weaker. It also lets Sneasler OHKO most Incineroar with Close Combat and guarantee the OHKO on Primarina with Dire Claw. Tera Dark lets Sneasler's Throat Chop OHKO Basculegion-M almost all of the time as well as making Sneasler immune to the Psychic-type attacks that threaten it before Terastallizing.
  • Sneasler runs Grassy Seed or Psychic Seed depending on its partners; Grassy Seed works on offensive teams with Rillaboom, while Psychic Seed fits on hyper offense teams with Indeedee-M.
  • Once Sneasler has activated Unburden, it can no longer switch out without losing the Speed boost, restricting its flexibility and potentially not letting it get the full value out of Fake Out like a Focus Sash set would. Sneasler can also be vulnerable to getting OHKOed by stronger attacks without a Focus Sash.

Maushold.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Maushold can support various teams. It is most commonly used on rain and balance teams featuring Annihilape.
  • On rain teams, Maushold uses Beat Up to assist Archaludon in gaining Defense boosts from Stamina as well as increasing the damage of Rage Fist from Annihilape. It also provides redirection, allowing Annihilape to set up further with Bulk Up and other partners such as Basculegion-M to attack safely.
  • On balance teams, Maushold provides the same support to Annihilape and additionally supports partners such as Gholdengo and Kingambit with redirection, allowing them to safely set up with Nasty Plot and Swords Dance, respectively.
  • Maushold is threatened by Fighting-types such as Sneasler. Partners such as Annihilape and Gholdengo are difficult for Sneasler to KO and can easily KO Sneasler in return. Maushold is also walled by Ghost-types like Gholdengo. Incineroar can comfortably survive attacks from Gholdengo and threaten it with Knock Off. Taunt easily disrupts Maushold, requiring Maushold to switch out to remove the effect.

Strategy Comments

  • Maushold performs best when it redirects attacks and enabling its partners to set up safely and sweep. Leading Maushold is often a great choice, allowing its partners to take early-game KOs.
  • Maushold can be used flexibly. Follow Me is vital for granting its partner a turn to safely set up or take a KO at any point during the game, and the offensive set can sometimes deal just enough damage to take a surprising KO on a big opposing threat.
  • Maushold is easily disrupted by Taunt, so it needs to Taunt the opposing support Pokemon itself or rely on its partners to take out opposing Taunt users. Offensive Maushold is additionally threatened by Rocky Helmet and Rough Skin, both of which KO it after it has used Population Bomb.

Offensive Support.description:
• Offensive Maushold aims to soften up foes or take surprising KOs with Technician Population Bomb while also providing redirection and disruption support.
  • Population Bomb allows Maushold to deal devastating damage, especially with ten hits, which is enough to remove threats such as Dragonite. Taunt shuts down Trick Room setters like Porygon2 and opposing support Pokemon like Amoonguss.
  • Tera Ghost makes Maushold immune to Close Combat from Sneasler, Fake Out from Incineroar, and Extreme Speed from Dragonite. Tera Grass grants Maushold an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder. Tera Grass also provides useful resistances to Water- and Electric-type attacks such as Wave Crash from Basculegion and Electro Shot from Archaludon.
  • Wide Lens is used to increase the accuracy of Population Bomb, greatly increasing the chance of landing ten hits.
  • While this set is capable of dealing high damage, it is reliant on landing enough Population Bomb hits to take out or weaken threats. This set lacks defensive investment, so it is not expected to be able to redirect attacks throughout the battle.

Bulky Support.description:
• As a bulky support Pokemon, Maushold aims to redirect attacks for its partners as well as disrupt its foes. Maushold additionally has Friend Guard, increasing the survivability of its allies.
  • Beat Up is used to increase the power of Rage Fist from a partner Annihilape and grant Defense boosts to a partner Archaludon with Stamina; it can also be used to break Focus Sashes. Taunt disrupts Trick Room setters and opposing support Pokemon like Porygon2 and Electabuzz.
  • Tera Ghost makes Maushold immune to Close Combat from Sneasler, Fake Out from Incineroar, and Extreme Speed from Dragonite. Tera Fairy turns Maushold's weakness to Close Combat into a resistance and provides an immunity to Outrage from Dragonite. Tera Fairy is also a great defensive typing into the metagame.
  • Safety Goggles grants Maushold an immunity to Spore and Rage Powder.
  • This Maushold set is capable of taking multiple attacks; however, it is easily disrupted by Taunt, forcing Maushold to be switched out to remove the effect. The set is also very passive and deals very low damage.

Glimmora.overview:
• Glimmora is a strong offensive threat with access to a good STAB combination and the powerful move Meteor Beam, which, when used with the Power Herb, can melt many targets, such as Assault Vest Entei and Incineroar. With Toxic Debris and signature move Mortal Spin, Glimmora can punish physical attackers and passive play, and, when combined with the threat of Meteor Beam, make it impossible to ignore while also requiring careful positioning to properly handle.

  • Glimmora has traditionally fit best on Dondozo teams, as the combination of Toxic Debris and Mortal Spin means your foes almost guaranteed to be afflicted with poison, putting your opponent on a timer. Assault Vest on Glimmora is especially effective on Dondozo teams, as the extra longevity helps it spread poison better and stall out even longer, making up for the lowered damage output.

  • With Meteor Beam, Glimmora can utilize its high Special Attack stat and good offensive typing as a damage dealer. Tornadus and Ogerpon-W are good partners; Tornadus provides speed control and can launch powerful Bleakwind Storms into Fighting-types that resist Meteor Beam and Ogerpon-W redirects potential Water- or Ground-type attacks while pressuring threats like Urshifu-R and Landorus. In return, Glimmora can threaten Grass-types, which resists both Ogerpon-W's STAB moves.

  • Glimmora's poor defensive typing, combined with its middling bulk and average Speed, makes Glimmora a glass cannon. Glimmora is weak to many prominent offensive threats such as Urshifu-R, Landorus, and Gholdengo. Glimmora also struggles to handle Rock-resistant foes such as Iron Hands, Kingambit, and Urshifu-R. Even then, many of these foes will concede Toxic Spikes while taking out Glimmora; for instance, Urshifu-R will set up both layers of Toxic Spikes if it attacks Glimmora. Amoonguss is another difficult match up, as it absords Toxic Spikes and takes Glimmora's attacks comfortably, while threatening a Spore.

Meteor Beam.description:
Meteor Beam's power against most neutral targets is devastating. The Special Attack boost allows Glimmora to output offensive pressure with Sludge Bomb even after Power Herb is consumed.

  • Earth Power is used as coverage for the Steel-types that resist Glimmora's STAB combination. Energy Ball is also an option to utilize the Tera Grass STAB boost and to hit Pokemon that resist Meteor Beam such as Urshifu-R but makes it so that Steel-types resist all of Glimmora's attacks.

  • The Special Attack investment along with the Modest nature is necessary to pick up a OHKO on Landorus, Walking Wake, and Terastillized Urshifu-R with Meteor Beam. The OHKO on Landorus and Urshifu turns the match up against hyper offensive teams completely on its head, especially with speed control support from Tornadus.

  • The Defense investment is enough to guarantee surviving Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and a favourable roll of taking Kingambit's Iron Head. The Special Defensive investment lets it live Gholdengo's Make It Rain and Latias's Mist Ball. The rest of the EVs are invested into Speed, which allows Glimmora to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T when in Tailwind.

  • Tera Grass has better synergy with Glimmora's original typing and provides an immunity to spore, but gives Glimmora weakness to common threats such as Chien-Pao. Tera Water, defensively, is a stronger neutral type into the metagame, but has fewer relevant resistances to common threats.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Both Earth Power and Energy Ball are fine options, but Energy Ball can do more damage against neutral targets if Glimmora Terastallizes into a Grass type.

  • Mortal Spin is used as the final move for a more consistent method to spread poison than Toxic Debris.

  • The Assault Vest gives Glimmora much more longevity, as it allows it to comfortably tank special attacks while still dissuading physical attackers with the threat of Toxic Spikes. On teams where being able to spread poison is important, Assault Vest is a good option.

  • The special bulk allows Glimmora to live many strong super effective attacks, such as Choice Specs Gholdengo's Make It Rain; it also makes Choice Specs Flutter Mane's Shadow Ball a 3HKO. Glimmora still lives a Rillaboom Wood Hammer with the HP investment.

Flamigo.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Flamigo works nicely alongside Earthquake users like Ursaluna and Garchomp, threatening the Grass-types that can easily take on Earthquake while also being immune to it. Redirection can help keep Flamigo away from attacks, considering its fragility.

  • Ursaluna and Garchomp can easily threaten Electabuzz and Magmar, which redirect Flamigo's attacks away from Pokemon Flamigo is meant to threaten like Gholdengo. The aforementioned Ground-types can also avoid redirection with Earthquake. Porygon2 can hit Flying-types with Ice Beam and Thunderbolt. Gholdengo can threaten Fairy-types like Sylveon and Hatterene, which resist Flamigo's Close Combat.

  • Multi-hit moves like Scale Shot from Dragonite are a major issue, as they can OHKO Flamigo through Focus Sash. These multi-hit moves can be redirected with the help of Amoonguss, while the damage can be mitigated with Intimidate from Incineroar.

Strategy Comments

  • Flamigo's main role is to be a wallbreaker that can threaten top Pokemon like Gholdengo and Incineroar. Flamigo really shines when against Steel-types like Gholdengo and Kingambit, threatening them with Close Combat.

  • Flamigo is meant to be brought first, but it can be saved in certain matchups, such as the Psychic-type spam matchup, since Wide Guard is able to deny Expanding Force and Eruption from foes such as Indeedee-M and Hisuian Typhlosion, respectively.

  • Faster Pokemon like Dragapult are some of the biggest threats to Flamigo, as they can bring Flamigo down to Focus Sash or double target Flamigo and KO it. Physically bulky Pokemon such as Dondozo can also be an issue, as they can take hits and deal good damage back. Bulky Flying-types like Dragonite and Corviknight can take on attacks from Flamigo while hitting hard back. Powerful special attackers like Gholdengo can take down the physically bulky foes. Electric- and Ice-type attacks like Thunderbolt and Ice Beam from Porygon2 can threaten these Flying-types, while Clear Smog Amoonguss does well into Dondozo.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Flamigo both hits hard and is decently fast, doing particularly well into threats such as Incineroar, Gholdengo, and Sneasler thanks to its ability Scrappy and good offensive typing.

  • Dual Wingbeat is a respectably strong attack that is able to OHKO Pokemon through Focus Sash, notably Sneasler. Brave Bird is able to pick up OHKOes onto Pokemon such as Rillaboom and is more consistent than Dual Wingbeat, but it breaks Flamigo's own Focus Sash, leaving it vulnerable to attacks. Wide Guard can protect Flamigo and its partners from powerful spread attacks like Eruption from Hisuian Typhlosion, Make It Rain from Gholdengo, and Expanding Force from the likes of Indeedee-M and Hatterene.

  • Focus Sash allows Flamigo to guarantee surviving at least one attack, which is especially useful with its low bulk and the stat drops from Close Combat.

  • Tera Ghost lets Flamigo ignore Fake Out, being able to OHKO many sturdy threats such as Rillaboom and Incineroar without being at risk of their partner's attack. Tera Ghost also stops Extreme Speed from knocking out Flamigo when its health has been lowered, as well as preventing Extreme Speed and Fake Out from breaking Focus Sash. Tera Stellar increases Flamigo's damage output, notably OHKOing Archaludon with Close Combat.

Dondozo.comments:
Teambuilding

  • The sweeper set tends to be strong on hyper offensive teams that can force trades, weakening Dondozo's checks into range of its attacks. Dondozo can also be used to weaken foes early-game, putting the opposing team into range of an alternative late-game sweeper like Gholdengo or Indeedee-M. Spread moves are extremely strong with Dondozo, as they allow it to put an opposing team into range of Dondozo's attacks. Speed control such as Tailwind is also strong with Dondozo, as it allows it to outspeed threats like Sneasler and Dragapult. Meanwhile, bulky Dondozo provides a defensive Water-type that can disrupt foes by putting them to sleep, and it's helpful to enable its setup partners.
  • Tatsugiri-C is a mandatory partner for sweeper Dondozo, as with Commander, it combines with Dondozo to give it a +2 boost to every stat. Talonflame is a strong partner for Dondozo, damaging the Grass-types like Rillaboom and Amoonguss that might give Dondozo issues as well as providing Tailwind speed control that allows it and its team to pick up KOs on Pokemon they would otherwise be slower against, which is beneficial for Dondozo's hyper offense-focused gameplan. Another strong partner is Choice Scarf Annihilape. With Coaching, Annilhilape allows Dondozo to becomes even more threatening than it already is. Indeedee-M and Sneasler are very strong partners for this Dondozo variant as well; the combination of them can apply pressure to some of Dondozo's checks like Primarina, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss as well as applying significant pressure to Incineroar, which could otherwise give Dondozo some trouble, and the Speed boost gained from activating Psychic Seed lets Unburden Sneasler become the fastest Pokemon in the metagame, allowing it to provide significant pressure and make room for a Dondozo win later in the game.
  • Common partners for support Dondozo include bulky setup Pokemon like Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Volcarona, which tend to struggle against Fire-types, which Dondozo can beat, and in turn, they resist Grass-type attacks for Dondozo and appreciate the free turns Dondozo can generate with Yawn in order to setup. Rillaboom is another strong partner for this Dondozo set, allowing it to get free turns to use Yawn with Fake Out, providing Dondozo with Grassy Terrain to boost its longevity even further, and switching into Grass-types that are used to check Dondozo, such as opposing Rillaboom and Amoonguss. Dondozo also helps Rillaboom in matchups against Fire-types, which often give it trouble. Dondozo also appreciates being paired with Follow Me users like Magmar and Electabuzz, as they can redirect Spore from Amoonguss, hamper it with Taunt, or, in Magmar's case, threaten it with a super effective Overheat. They also help to redirect attacks that Dondozo doesn't want to take, like Electro Shot from Archaludon and Wood Hammer from Rillaboom.
  • Sweeper Dondozo has a lot of trouble with Haze Primarina and Clear Smog Amoonguss, which threaten to remove its stat boosts and make it a sitting duck. Because of this, many of Dondozo's partners, like Talonflame and Sneasler, are tasked with pressuring them early-game so that they do not have an opportunity to get rid of Dondozo's stat boosts. The pivoting core of Incineroar and Amoonguss also causes Dondozo some issues, as Amoonguss can put Dondozo to sleep with Spore, and Incineroar can use Intimidate and Parting Shot to drop Dondozo's Attack greatly. Pokemon like Choice Scarf Annihilape and Indeedee-M can help solve this issue, as Annihilape can use Final Gambit to remove a defensive piece on teams using Incineroar + Amoonguss such as Porygon2 while being able to OHKO Incineroar with Close Combat and boost off Intimidate via Defiant, while Indeedee-M immediately pressures Amoonguss with Expanding Force and blocks Fake Out from Incineroar with Psychic Terrain, making it easier for Dondozo to knock out Incineroar with a super effective Wave Crash.
  • Bulky Dondozo is checked by Pokemon that can hit it for super effective damage, like Rillaboom and Archaludon, or give it trouble by switching around it and hindering it with status or stat drops, such as Amoonguss, Incineroar, and other supportive Dondozo. Electabuzz and Magmar are other checks to Dondozo, as they are immune to Yawn with Vital Spirit and can allow room for a partner to pressure Dondozo with Follow Me; additionally, Magmar can burn Dondozo with Will-O-Wisp, and Electabuzz can hit it super effectively with Thunderbolt. Your own forms of redirection, such as Electabuzz and Magmar, as well as some Pokemon that naturally threaten Grass-types, like Sneasler, Volcarona, and Baxcalibur, all make for great partners to Dondozo. Kingambit also helps deter Intimidate from Incineroar and can use Rillaboom to set up Swords Dance and sweep. Gholdengo can also set up on Rillaboom while naturally being immune to Spore thanks to Good As Gold.

Strategy Comments

  • Commander-boosted Dondozo's main job is to act as either a wallbreaker or a sweeper, depending on the situation. Dondozo can often win the game on the spot if placed in the right position, so choosing when to combine Dondozo with Tatsugiri-C is critical. Dondozo can often be used to weaken an opposing team to the point where its partners, like Indeedee-M, can clean up the game; conversely, Dondozo's teammates can weaken the opposition to the point where it can clean up the game with its powerful boosted attacks. Meanwhile, bulky Dondozo's main role is to act as a bulky support Pokemon that can force switches with Yawn, putting its foes in awkward positions by forcing them to either switch out or fall asleep, which allows room for Dondozo's partners, such as Kingambit, Gholdengo, and Volcarona, to set up and threaten the opponent. This is often accomplished by bringing in Dondozo against foes that it walls and using Yawn on them.
  • Sweeper Dondozo teams often involve making smart early-game trades and identifying whether a threat is important to keep alive after Dondozo comes in and goes down or whether it is more important for it to do damage or KO a threat to Dondozo, allowing it to get a late-game sweep. It is also important to identify when Tatsugiri-C should come in to combine with Dondozo, as once this is done, they are fully committed and can no longer switch, making Dondozo vulnerable to being played around and answered. Dondozo should come in once enough damage has been done to the enemy team or in order to deal damage to the opposing team to allow a late-game cleanup from one of Dondozo's partners. Meanwhile, bulky Dondozo is strong both early-game and late-game, depending on the situation. Dondozo tends to use Yawn for a lot of the game, and its high bulk allows it to stick around for many turns at a time. Dondozo can also be used to provide important chip damage against foes that may threaten its partners, such as Incineroar and Volcarona, which gives Dondozo's setup partners more room to break through them. Dondozo can also force opposing setup threats, such as Kingambit, Volcarona, and Archaludon, to switch out, which makes room for its own setup ally to get in the game and threaten a sweep.
  • Sweeper Dondozo is checked by every form of Amoonguss, especially Clear Smog Amoonguss, as well as Haze Primarina. Forcing early-game trades to force these pieces on the board followed by dealing significant damage to them to clean up with Dondozo is important. It is also important to understand that Dondozo should not come in every matchup, as it is just too hard to get value with Dondozo in many of them. It is vital to identify whether or not Dondozo is a good Pokemon to bring into the match with the team you are facing up against. If the opponent has enough ways to threaten Dondozo and severly hinder its progress or if Dondozo struggled to get value in a previous game, leaving Dondozo behind should be considered. Dondozo is also often checked by Rillaboom, using Fake Out to pivot around it and threatening super effective damage with Wood Hammer. It is important to force damage onto Rillaboom to allow Dondozo to pick up the KO on it or soften it up with Dondozo to allow a teammate to pick it up. The core of Incineroar and Amoonguss is also really strong against Dondozo, so it is important to limit switching and pressure Incineroar as much as possible. Softening up Incineroar and Amoonguss with early-game pressure from the likes of Indeedee-M, Annihilape, and any other offensive partners you might have is important, and putting yourself in a favorable position against a weakened Amoonguss to KO it or its partner Incineroar is very important as well. On the other hand, bulky Dondozo is often checked by Rillaboom; however, many of Dondozo's Grass-resistant partners appreciate the ability to take advantage of Rillaboom to either set up in Volcarona and Kingambit's case or hit it super effectively in Sneasler's case. Another one of Dondozo's checks is Amoonguss, which can take advantage of Dondozo's passivity and incapacitate it with Spore, and it often doesn't mind Yawn because with Regenerator, it often likes switching out anyway. Dondozo can take advantage of it by using its partner Electabuzz or Magmar to exploit Amoonguss, using their Spore immunity to play around it and allow their sweeper to set up with smart positioning. Electabuzz can also disable Amoonguss with Taunt, which Dondozo appreciates, while Magmar can threaten Amoonguss with super effective damage, which weakens it enough to be taken advantage of late-game.

Commander Sweeper.description:
• Combining with Tatsugiri-C allows Dondozo to become a threatening sweeper, being able to pose a significant threat to the majority of teams. Its significant bulk and attacking prowess allow it to rip through unprepared teams and make it hard to remove without consistent answers.
  • Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest attacking move, providing a great source of damage to neutral targets such as Gholdengo and Annihilape. Earthquake provides a spread attack that can get around redirection users such as Electabuzz, Magmar, Clefable, and Amoonguss.
  • Order Up provides a way for Dondozo to boost its Attack without Coaching, allowing it to become even more threatening if the opponent attempts to play around it passively. Order Up also provides a way to hit Dragon-types like Dragonite and Baxcalibur.
  • Heavy Slam allows Dondozo to hit Fairy-types that can otherwise check it like Primarina, Alolan Ninetales and Clefable, and it can be boosted even further by Tera Steel.
  • Tera Steel allows Dondozo to become immune to Clear Smog from opposing Amoonguss as well as boosting the power of Dondozo's Heavy Slam, allowing it to OHKO physically defensive Amoonguss at +3. Tera Grass allows Dondozo to become immune to Spore from Amoonguss as well as allowing Dondozo to resist Ground-type attacks from Garchomp, Ursaluna, and Ursaluna-B.
  • Unaware is used to ignore setup threats such as Volcarona, Gholdengo and Archaludon who could otherwise give Dondozo some issues, it also allows Dondozo to defeat other Commander Dondozo.
  • Leftovers provides Dondozo with a little bit more longevity, as its naturally high bulk paired with the +2 Defense and Special Defense boosts lets it shrug off attacks and heal them off, and this recovery tends to rack up very quickly if it's alternating between attacking and using Protect.
  • The Speed investment on this set allows it to outspeed maximum Speed Garchomp after combining with Tatsugiri-C and threaten it greatly with Wave Crash or Order Up. The Attack investment allows +3 Tera Steel Heavy Slam to get a OHKO on physically defensive Amoonguss and allows +1 Earthquake to 2HKO most Sitrus Berry Incineroar.

Bulky Yawn.description:
• This Dondozo set aims to be a much bulkier supporting piece that is used without Tatsugiri while still managing to provide a bit of offensive pressure thanks to its attacking options.
  • Yawn is Dondozo's main supporting tool, allowing it to force switches or put the enemy to sleep depending on what it goes for. This can put the opponent into an awkward position, which generates free turns for your partner Pokemon.
  • Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest attacking move. Alternatively, Liquidation can be used to circumvent the recoil of Wave Crash and give Dondozo more longevity.
  • Fissure is used in situations where Dondozo isn't providing any pressure on the field, as Dondozo tends to be extremely passive against Pokemon naturally immune to its sleep move like Electabuzz and Gholdengo or Pokemon that like to pivot a lot naturally and don't mind taking its Water-type attack like Amoonguss, Porygon2, and other supportive Dondozo. Fissure gives Dondozo a way to provide pressure against these Pokemon that can normally wall it, and since Dondozo is so bulky, a miss often won't lose you the game.
  • Unaware allows Dondozo to check setup sweepers that could otherwise beat it such as Volcarona, Gholdengo, Kingambit and Archaludon, allowing it to take their boosted attacks and force them out with Yawn.
  • Tera Poison allows Dondozo to resist Grass-type attacks as well as gaining important resistances to Fighting and Poison, allowing it to wall Sneasler. Tera Bug and Grass allow Dondozo to resist Ground-type attacks rather than being weak to it, unlike Tera Poison; while Tera Grass allows it to gain an immunity to Rage Powder and Spore from Amoonguss, Tera Bug allows Dondozo to not be weak to Ice-type moves from Alolan Ninetales and Baxcalbur as well as Poison-type moves from Sneasler.
  • The EVs on this set allow Dondozo to survive two Electro Shots from Archaludon after Dondozo uses Protect for a turn if Grassy Terrain is up.

Offensive Sweeper.description:
• Wave Crash is Dondozo's strongest Water-type move, OHKOing Pokemon like Tornadus and Gholdengo. Earthquake bypasses Follow Me from Ogerpon-W, and provides it a strong spread move thats picks off weakened foes.

  • Rocky Helmet breaks Focus Sash on Chien-Pao and Urshifu, allowing for an OHKO. It also allows for big damage on Urshifu-R using Surging Strikes. Leftovers allows Dondozo to recover swathes of health, even more so by stalling with Protect. However, its harder to use now, as most threats to Dondozo can outdamage Leftovers recovery, especially so considering the Urshifu formes ignore Protect. Clear Amulet can be used to remove ways to weaken Dondozo, primarily Incineroar and Gouging Fire.

  • 20 Defense EVs ensure that Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao is a 4HKO and allow Dondozo to survive two Wicked Blows from Urshifu-S. 76 Special Defense EVs allow Dondozo to survive two Moonblasts from Tera Fairy Choice Specs Flutter Mane. The Attack investment ensures Wave Crash OHKOes Urshifu-S after Rocky Helmet damage and that Order Up 2HKOes Ogerpon-W and Urshifu-R.

  • Tera Grass provides resistances to Grass- and Electric-type attacks, as well as giving an immunity to Spore from Amoonguss, which is otherwise difficult to deal with.

Supportive Yawn.description:
• Dondozo can utilize its strong natural bulk and typing to function as a supportive wall with Yawn.

  • Yawn Dondozo pairs best with Ting-Lu, as a combination of Sand Tomb and Yawn can reliably slow down foes and Ting-Lu's Vessel of Ruin helps with Dondozo's frailer Special Defense.

  • Dondozo struggles against Rillaboom and Amoonguss, as both resist Wave Crash, and it is harder to make damage over time stick with Grassy Terrain and Pollen Puff respectively. Additionally, the former threatens super effective damage on Dondozo and the latter threatens Spore.

  • Leftovers recovery gives Dondozo additional staying power in slower-paced battles compared to recovery Berries.

  • Oblivious prevents Dondozo from being shut down with Taunt from PokÃ©mon such as Tornadus or affected by Intimidate from foes like Incineroar.

  • The invested bulk allows Dondozo to survive Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt, as well as surviving two Earth Powers from Landorus and OHKOing in return with Wave Crash. Heavy Slam is used to OHKO Flutter Mane.

Tatsugiri.comments: • Tatsugiri is solely used to combine with Dondozo and shouldn't be picked outside of that purpose.

Commander Support.description:
• Tatsugiri only appears on teams to enable Dondozo with its Commander ability and potentially offer some support and damage.
  • Icy Wind offers speed control and considerable damage into the likes of Garchomp and Dragonite, though it only appears on Choice Scarf sets. Draco Meteor is a high-damage STAB option with drawbacks, while Dragon Pulse offers consistent damage. Taunt can stop status moves like Spore from Amoonguss; Follow Me from Electabuzz, Magmar, and Maushold; and Trick Room from Porygon2 and the Indeedee formes. Taunt in combination with Safety Goggles can ignore Rage Powder to stop opposing setup. The status moves are not intended for a Choice Scarf set. Protect appears on Focus Sash and Safety Goggles sets, and it can be used to bait attacks into Tatsugiri before Dondozo is sent out, drawing damage away from Tatsugiri's partner.
  • Choice Scarf lets Tatsugiri outspeed the entire metagame if the opponent does not have Speed boosts, though it is less flexible. Focus Sash aids survivability for Tatsugiri, with its low defensive presence, but the set lacks speed control. Safety Goggles stops Tatsugiri from getting punished by a slow Spore on the turn Dondozo faints. The Safety Goggles set has mediocre Speed and bulk and can be taken out by fast offensive threats.
  • Tera Ghost is useful for blocking moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which will quickly break a Focus Sash. Tera Steel turns Tatsugiri's weaknesses to Dragon, Fairy, and Freeze Dry into resistances and adds other useful resistances, such as to Grass- and Normal-type moves like Wood Hammer, Blood Moon, and Hyper Voice. Tera Stellar boosts general offense, given that Focus Sash Tatsugiri is likely to survive a turn.

Choice Scarf Support.description:
• Icy Wind is used as a late-game speed control option. Dragon Pulse is a more consistent STAB move compared to Draco Meteor and Muddy Water, at the cost of damage. Sleep Talk allows Tatsugiri to better answer Amoonguss, while Tera Blast hits Flutter Mane and Chien-Pao in the rare circumstances where Tatsugiri is Terastallized.

  • Choice Scarf allows Tatsugiri to clean up late-game once Dondozo is down, either serving as speed control with Icy Wind to support its partner or dealing damage with Muddy Water and Draco Meteor.

  • The given EVs allow Tatsugiri to outspeed Choice Scarf Landorus-T and survive an Icicle Crash from Chien-Pao and a Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Steel gives Tatsugiri a resistance to Dragon and Fairy and a generally better defensive profile. Tera Water can be used to boost Muddy Water's damage and remove its weakness to Flutter Mane's Fairy-type STAB moves, which is useful in some end-game scenarios.

Farigiraf.overview:
• Farigiraf's excellent bulk combined with the immunity to Prankster Taunt and Fake Out given by Armor Tail ability make Farigiraf an extremely consistent Trick Room setter. This is because its ability prevents Farigiraf from being taunted by the main Taunt user in the format, Tornadus, and the opponent can no longer use Fake Out to stall out Trick Room turns. Additionally, Armor Tail gives Farigiraf a great matchup against Pokemon that rely on priority like Rillaboom and Dragonite.

  • The different Ogerpon formes are all great partners for Farigiraf, because the redirection means Trick Room is almost guaranteed to go up, while their Grass typing means that Spore is no longer an issue. Ogerpon-W has a great defensive typing and can easily tank most hits it redirects away from Farigiraf, Ogerpon-H hits Amoonguss and the Steel-types that resist Farigiraf's moves, and Ogerpon-C is particularly helpful for redirection due to its Sturdy ability. Rillaboom and Incineroar are also great partners, as Fake Out + Trick Room is a great combination due to the fact that Fake Out prevents both opponents from attacking Farigiraf before Trick Room goes up.

  • Partners that are physically frail or weak to one of the big priority moves like Urshifu-R really enjoy having it as an ally. Flutter Mane is an excellent partner, as it can handily deal with the Dark-types that Farigiraf struggles against, and Ursaluna-B is a strong Trick Room sweeper that enjoys being immune to the Fake Out cycling from Incineroar and Rillaboom.

  • Farigiraf can have a difficult time against Pokemon that can threaten to OHKO it both in and out of Terastallization, like Kingambit and Urshifu-S. Another issue is opposing Trick Room Pokemon, especially Torkoal and Amoonguss, the former being able to outspeed Farigiraf inside of Trick Room and OHKO it with Tera Fire-sun-boosted Eruptions, and the latter being able to put any Farigiraf that isn't running Safety Goggles to sleep and just being a general threat when Trick Room is up.

Bulky Support.description:
• While Psychic and Trick Room are self-explanatory, Dazzling Gleam is a fantastic option to hit Dark-types. Psychic Noise is a good option, as it completely restricts the use of Horn Leech from the Ogerpon formes, and Drain Punch from Iron Hands, which Farigiraf's partners might be weak to; Psychic Noise also stops all Pokemon from healing from Rillaboom's Grassy Terrain. Imprison is used to block opposing Trick Room while also stopping opposing Flutter Mane from using Dazzling Gleam. Protect is just a generally consistent option, allowing Farigiraf to stick around to provide the team with priority blocking for longer.

  • Sitrus Berry is generally preferred, as the extra recovery allows it to live important attack combos such as Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash into Entei's Sacred Fire; however, Safety Goggles is also a valid option, allowing it to ignore Spore from opposing Amoonguss, a common counter to Trick Room.

  • With Sitrus Berry recovery, Farigiraf can always survive an Icicle Crash from Adamant Chien-Pao and a Sword of Ruin-boosted Sacred Fire from Entei. The Special Defense investment allows Farigiraf to live an unboosted Overheat from Timid Chi-Yu. The rest of the EVs were put into offense.

  • Fairy is the best Tera type on Farigiraf in this format, allowing it to resist common Dark-type attacks from Urshifu-S and Kingambit. It also allows Farigiraf to deal more substantial chip damage with Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam, allowing it to OHKO Urshifu-S.

Offensive.description:
• Hyper Voice activates Throat Spray to inflict a lot of damage and boost subsequent Psychics. Psyshock deals less damage than Psychic overall, but it allows Farigiraf to hit Flutter Mane and Assault Vest Pokemon like Rillaboom harder.

  • Throat Spray allows Farigiraf to put really good amounts of pressure unlike other Trick Room setters. Life Orb allows for more immediate damage and more pivoting ability, as you wont lose the damage boost when switching out, but provides less damage overall.

  • The HP and Special Defense EVs allow Farigiraf to survive Tera Fairy Moonblast from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, Tera Normal Helping Hand-boosted Hyper Voice from Life Orb Ursaluna-B, as well as non-Tera Life Orb Blood Moon. The heavy amount of Special Attack investment allows Farigiraf to serve its role as an offensive Pokemon very well, especially after a Throat Spray boost. The Defense investment allows Farigiraf to take Surging Strikes from Tera Water Choice Scarf Urshifu-R.

Kingambit.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Coverage for Fighting-, Fairy- and Dark-types such as Primarina, Incineroar, and Sneasler is almost necessary when teambuilding with Kingambit. Both sets enjoy having redirection on their side, including the likes of Clefable, Electabuzz, and Amoonguss, which can easily take in Fighting-type attacks from threats like Annihilape and Sneasler. Swords Dance Kingambit can take advantage of redirection to a greater extent, since this can open windows for setup opportunities.

  • Rillaboom is a really good partner for Kingambit, providing setup opportunities with Fake Out and threatening Ground-types such as the Ursaluna formes. Dark-resistant Pokemon like Incineroar and even opposing Kingambit can be covered by Primarina, which also has great defensive synergy with Kingambit. Sneasler also works at removing Dark-types while also removing Fairy-types and providing another source of Fake Out support for Kingambit.

  • Kingambit, thanks to its typing, is extremely weak to Fighting-types, including Annihilape, Sneasler, and Flamigo, which prove to be an issue. The aforementioned Amoonguss and Clefable can take in these Fighting-type attacks. Primarina, as mentioned before, has great defensive synergy with Kingambit, taking Fighting- and Fire-type attacks with ease, while Kingambit can cover for it against Grass- and Poison-type attacks.

Strategy Comments

  • Kingambit's main role is either a setup sweeper with Swords Dance or a defensive pivot piece with Asssault Vest. Swords Dance Kingambit's main goal is to set up and stay healthy; redirection and Fake Out support are usually necessary in achieving this. With Tera Dark and at +2, it's very easy for Kingambit to pick up momentum quickly and blitz through careless players. Don't be greedy with using Swords Dances, as it's easy for Kingambit to be OHKOed or brought to low health with careful positioning around Sucker Punch, especially in a format with Fighting-type coverage everywhere.

  • Kingambit succeeds as a setup sweeper thanks to its typing, bulk, and on Assault Vest sets, coverage. Its typing has many resistances to top types like Dragon, making Kingambit an amazing counter to Dragapult and Hydreigon. Kingambit's bulk, especially when it's paired with Assault Vest, is really good, allowing Kingambit to withstand hits and potentially turn the tables in a losing late-game position.

  • Dark-resistant Pokemon are a huge issue for Kingambit, easily taking Kowtow Cleave and Sucker Punch even if they're boosted. These Pokemon can be taken care of by partners such as Primarina and Sneasler. Fighting-types, including the likes of Annihilape, can be a massive issue, easily using Kingambit to set up. Sneasler in particular can be a problem, only taking notable damage from Iron Head. Fighting-type coverage moves is also rather prevalent in the metagame, with Pokemon like Low Kick Tyranitar and Body Press Archaludon being common. For this, Ghost-type switch-ins like Dragapult or redirection can be helpful in deterring Fighting-type attacks. Additionally, opposing Sneasler can be picked off by Dragapult. Offensive Fairy-types such as Primarina can scare Kingambit away from Terastallizing into a Dark-type, as Moonblast would otherwise easily chunk Kingambit. Sneasler can easily deal with Fairy-types by hitting them hard with Dire Claw.

Offensive.description:
• Kingambit is easily able to steamroll through teams, having a great typing both offensively and defensively and easily defeating metagame staples like Gholdengo as well as decimating foes thanks to Swords Dance. Swords Dance bolsters Kingambit's Attack such that it can pick up OHKOs on bulky Pokemon such as Rillaboom, Ursaluna-B, and Amoonguss using Kowtow Cleave, with the latter two requiring Tera Dark.

  • Sucker Punch compensates for Kingambit's low Speed while also immediately either forcing out or pinning Choice item attackers and Assault Vest users. On top of that, Sucker Punch can cause mind games, with Kingambit potentially just using Kowtow Cleave while forcing a switch with the threat of Sucker Punch. Low Kick can defeat Tyranitar and opposing Kingambit as well as Incineroar. Iron Head can be used as coverage for Dark-resistant Pokemon like Primarina and Sneasler, but it's generally harder to pilot and use.

  • Black Glasses is used to boost the main two moves on Kingambit, Kowtow Cleave and Sucker Punch. It allows +2 Kowtow Cleave to OHKO Rillaboom outright and Archaludon with Tera Dark as well as letting Kingambit pick off Volcarona with a +2 Sucker Punch. Safety Goggles stops Sucker Punch from getting redirected and negated by Rage Powder, which can be a huge issue for Kingambit. Safety Goggles can also deny Spore, allowing Kingambit to use Amoonguss to set up. Safety Goggles can miss key OHKOs on the Pokemon shown in the aforementioned calculations.

  • Tera Dark boosts Kingambit's damage further, allowing for OHKOs on Maushold and Gholdengo with Sucker Punch, as well as removing Kingambit's Fire weakness and 4x Fighting weakness, proving to be useful against threats like Incineroar, which Kingambit otherwise struggles to get rid of, and certain Fighting-type coverage and Pokemon like opposing Kingambit's Low Kick and Annihilape, which otherwise OHKO Kingambit.

  • Kingambit is really difficult to stop after a Swords Dance boost and Terastallizing, OHKOing Ursaluna with Kowtow Cleave. This set struggles with four-moveslot syndrome, as having to pick between the flexibility of Swords Dance and a coverage move is difficult. Another issue that this set has is that it can be really difficult to take Dark-resistant Pokemon down, such as Incineroar. For this, setting up in front of another Pokemon or removing the Dark-resistant Pokemon can help Kingambit thrive.

Assault Vest.description:
• Assault Vest Kingambit is great at taking strong hits whilst hitting back hard thanks to its high Attack stat. Its typing works amazing defensively thanks to the lack of good Ground- and Fighting-types, which is even better considering Assault Vest Kingambit works well as a bulky switch-in to many metagame staples such as Gholdengo. Defiant is very powerful on this set due to the lack of Swords Dance.

  • Low Kick is used as coverage for Dark-types, beating Pokemon such as Incineroar and opposing Kingambit.

  • Assault Vest allows Kingambit to take attacks like Earth Power from Ursaluna-B and Electro Shot from Archaludon as well as surviving extremely powerful attacks such as +1 Fiery Dance from Volcarona.

  • Fire is arguably the best Tera type on this set, providing a resistance to Fire while also removing Kingambit's weakness to Fighting. As a bonus, Tera Fire grants Kingambit a burn immunity, being very useful when facing foes like Talonflame. Tera Flying removes both Kingambit's Ground- and Fighting-type weaknesses, turning them into an immunity and a resistances, respectively. Tera Dark boosts Kingambit's Dark-type STAB moves, which can be very necessary due to not using Swords Dance.

  • The physical bulk investment lets Kingambit survive a Drain Punch from Annihilape and a rain-boosted Wave Crash from Basculegion-M. With the given special bulk, Kingambit can survive a +1 Fiery Dance from Volcarona and an Earth Power from Ursaluna-B. The offensive investment lets Sucker Punch OHKO Gholdengo with a Defiant boost while OHKOing Dragapult 75% of the time without it.

  • Assault Vest Kingambit is more flexible in move choices compared to Swords Dance variations, able to freely carry Iron Head and coverage moves as well as generally being more flexible in playstyle. With Assault Vest, this set has great survivability. However, Assault Vest Kingambit doesn't have much sweeping potential due to not running Swords Dance. Not being able to run Protect is also a noteworthy issue, as in a metagame where Trick Room and weather are everywhere, this drawback can make it difficult to position Kingambit and its allies.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• The given EV spread allows Kingambit to survive Life Orb Ursaluna-B's Earth Power or an Ivy Cudgel from Ogerpon-H as well as avoid the 3HKO from Raging Bolt's Thunderbolt. The Speed investment allows Kingambit to outspeed Landorus in tailwind.

  • Low Kick allows Kingambit to threaten Dark-Types such as Incineroar and opposing Kingambit; however, Tera Blast can also be used to cover for Dark- and Fighting-Types at the cost of needing to Terastallize.

Scream Tail.overview:
• Scream Tail has strong supportive moves such as Encore and Disable, which it can consistently use to disrupt opposing Pokemon thanks to its great natural bulk and Speed.

  • Scream Tail works well alongside Pokemon such as Gholdengo and Ogerpon-W, as it can punish passive plays and shut down Choice-locked threats such as opposing Flutter Mane and Urshifu-R, locking them into resisted Fairy- and Water-type attacks for Gholdengo and Ogerpon-W, respectively.

  • Scream Tail cannot provide any offensive pressure outside Dazzling Gleam and hence is completely reliant on its partners to deal damage. It is also vulnerable to being shut down by moves such as Taunt from Tornadus and Spore from Amoonguss. Scream Tail struggles against Gholdengo, which completely counters Scream Tail by being immune to status moves thanks to Good as Gold.

Support.description:
• Booster Energy allows Scream Tail to outspeed most of the metagame and launch fast Encores and Disables.

  • Dazzling Gleam is used to chip low health targets. Disable and Encore are great supportive tools to disrupt foes and can punish passive play.

  • The EV spread allows it to survive Choice Specs Flutter Mane Shadow Ball while comfortably taking a Tera Water Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and Tera Dark Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S.

  • Tera Dark is preferred for Prankster Taunt immunity and a Ghost resistance. Alternatively, Tera Grass can be used to provide immunity to powder moves from Amoonguss.

Flutter Mane.overview:
• Flutter Mane's extraordinary Special Attack and Speed combined with its fantastic offensive typing makes it one of the most effective cleaners in the format, 2HKOing the majority of the metagame. Flutter Mane can also play a supportive role for its team thanks to Icy Wind and Speed Booster Energy.

  • Offensive sets appreciate Pokemon that bring speed control like Latias and Tornadus, as well as Pokemon that provide it with longevity like Incineroar and Amoonguss. Supportive sets instead become the speed control and help support slower offensive Pokemon like Urshifu-R and Chi-Yu. Chi-Yu works particularly well as a partner, bolstering Flutter Mane's damage with Beads of Ruin and checking Steel-types like Kingambit while Flutter Mane takes care of Fighting-types like Urshifu-R in return.

  • Bulky Assault Vest users that can take a boosted Moonblast and OHKO Flutter Mane in response like Kingambit and Rillaboom are some of its toughest matchups. Flutter Mane also faces issues into faster threats like Chien-Pao and Choice Scarf Urshifu-R. Additionally, redirectors like Indeedee-F and Ogerpon-W mitigate its damage output when on the field.

Offensive.description:
• Flutter Mane is an effective cleaner thanks to Moonblast, which is its strongest STAB move, and Dazzling Gleam, which provides spread damage.

  • Special Attack Booster Energy is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item if it wants to keep Protect. Fairy Feather can be used instead, allowing it to retain its offensive boosts when switching at the cost of damage.

  • The EV spread is built to survive an Ice Spinner from Jolly Chien-Pao and to outspeed Tornadus, with the remaining EVs boosting Flutter Mane's Special Attack

  • Flutter Mane appreciates Tera Fairy to further boost its damage on Moonblast and Dazzling Gleam . This also removes its Ghost weakness and makes it resist Dark-type attacks, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Kingambit.

Choice Specs.description:
• Choice Specs is Flutter Mane's strongest boosting item and allows it to do immediate damage.

  • Flutter Mane utilizes Icy Wind as a speed control option and as coverage to threaten chipped Landorus. Thunderbolt and Power Gem are strong coverage options for important Pokemon like Tera Water Urshifu-R and Incineroar, respectively.

  • The above spread allows Flutter Mane to survive a Surging Strikes from a Choice Scarf Urshifu-R while outspeeding Adamant Chien-Pao. The remaining EVs are used to maximise its Special Attack.

  • Flutter Mane takes advantage of Tera Fairy by removing its Ghost weakness and giving it a Dark resistance, allowing it to better deal with opposing Flutter Mane and survive a potential Sucker Punch from Pokemon like Chien-Pao. Tera Fairy also allows Flutter Mane to secure an OHKO on Tera Water Urshifu-R.

Speed-Boosting Support.description:
• Flutter Mane requires Icy Wind to accomplish its role as speed control, forcing it to pick between Dazzling Gleam and Moonblast.

  • Speed Booster Energy allows Flutter Mane to outspeed the majority of the metagame.

  • With Booster Energy, Flutter Mane can outspeed opposing Chien-Pao at -1 and Modest Gholdengo in Tailwind. The defensive investment lets it survive Adamant Chien-Pao's Ice Spinner and Gholdengo's Make It Rain.

  • Tera Fairy is appreciated to gain more of an offensive presence and helps against opposing Flutter Mane, as Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is unable to OHKO opposing Flutter Mane with Shadow Ball.

Iron Bundle.overview:
• Iron bundle is the fastest threat in Regulation F thanks to Booster Energy and is used as a speed control option. It can threaten Landorus, Ogerpon-W, Incineroar, and Urshifu-R with super effective damage and an OHKO on the former two.

  • Iron Bundle appreciates offensive Pokemon that take advantage of Icy Wind like Urshifu-S, Ogerpon-H, Choice Specs Flutter Mane, and Landorus. Flutter Mane and Landorus specifically threaten Kingambit and Urshifu for Iron Bundle.

  • Iron Bundle is weak to priority attackers like Rillaboom, Chien-Pao, Dragonite, and Raging Bolt, since they can ignore Iron Bundle's Speed and Icy Wind's Speed drops while still pressuring it for huge damage if not an OHKO because of its low defenses.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Icy Wind is used for speed control, Hydro Pump is used as the main Water-STAB move, and Freeze-Dry is preferred to threaten common Water-types like Urshifu-R and Ogerpon-W.

  • Booster Energy is used to raise its Speed, which allows it to outspeed threats like Choice Scarf Urshifu-R, Booster Energy Flutter Mane, and Regidrago and Modest Landorus under Tailwind.

  • Tera Ghost is used for an immunity to threatening priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed.

Iron Hands.overview:
• Iron Hands is a strong Pokemon with high HP and Defense stats that allow it to be an effective switch-in to most neutral attacks, and it also has access to a powerful tool in Fake Out. Iron Hands's great stats allow it to output consistent pressure as well as making it hard to remove. Iron Hands has strong matchups into both Urshifu formes and Tornadus, and its great stats allow it to beat most of the metagame one-on-one.

  • Iron Hands appreciates speed control, so some good partners for it are Farigiraf and Tornadus. The combination of Armor Tail and Trick Room from Farigiraf and Fake Out from Iron Hands almost guarantees Trick Room is set up, which allows Iron Hands to dish out massive damage with Close Combat and Wild Charge. Tornadus is another good form of speed control for Iron Hands, since it can catch opponents off guard and synergizes better with faster offensive partners like the Urshifu formes and Ogerpon-H becauase their high Speed stats do not allow them to function in Trick Room effectively.

  • Iron Hands is weak to Pokemon that help mitigate damage like Incineroar and Landorus-T, since they can cycle Intimidate. This is a huge detriment for Iron Hands, since it is a Pokemon that likes staying on the field and whittle down its foes. Lowering its Attack stat does not allow it to do its job nearly as well. Iron Hands also has to make a very difficult choice in its held item. Clear Amulet leaves it susceptible to special attackers like Landorus and Flutter Mane, while Assault Vest leaves it susceptible to the aforementioned Incineroar and Landorus-T.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Close Combat is picked to allow an OHKO on Incineroar, Wild Charge is used as the most consistent Electric-type STAB move, and finally Heavy Slam is used as coverage against Flutter Mane and as a strong neutral option.

  • Clear Amulet prevents stat drops from Incineroar, allowing Iron Hands to play more offensively.

  • The Invested bulk allows Iron Hands to survive a Tera Fairy Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane, as well as two Icicle Crashes from Chien-Pao. The rest of the EVs are invested into Attack.

  • Tera Grass is used to resist attacks from Electric-resistant Ground- and Grass-type foes such as Landorus, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W while also providing a powder move immunity from Amoonguss. Tera Fire can also be used to resist Fairy- and Fire-type moves from Flutter Mane and Ogerpon-H; however, this keeps the weakness to Landorus as well as adding a Water-type weakness.

Offensive Pivot.description:
• Drain Punch is used, as Assault Vest Iron Hands wants to keep staying on the field, Wild Charge is used as the most consistent Electric-Type STAB move, and finally Heavy Slam is used as coverage for Flutter Mane and as a strong neutral option.

  • The 252 Special Defense EVs are used to minimize the damage taken from threatening special attacks like Earth Power from Landorus or Moonblast from Flutter Mane. The Speed EVs are used to outspeed the Urshifu formes and Adamant Ogerpon formes in Tailwind.

  • Assault Vest helps Iron Hands's low Special bulk and allows it to take super effective hits better.

  • Tera Grass is used to resist moves from Electric-resistant Ground- and Grass-type foes such as Landorus, Rillaboom, and Ogerpon-W while also providing a powder move immunity from Amoonguss. Tera Fire can also be used to resist Fairy- and Fire-type moves from Flutter Mane and Ogerpon-H; however, this keeps the weakness to Landorus as well as adding a Water-type weakness.

Iron Jugulis.overview:
• Iron Jugulis's great type combination and access to strong support moves such as Tailwind and Snarl make it a niche but powerful disruptive threat. With Booster Energy, Iron Jugulis is able to outspeed almost every other Pokemon in the format and use its great support options to apply pressure on the opponent with fast Snarls and Air Slashes. Its typing gives it an immunity to Prankster Taunt, as well as resistances to attacks from several common threats such as Rillaboom's Wood Hammer and Urshifu-S's Wicked Blow.

  • Iron Jugulis is used on semi-Trick Room teams with Farigiraf and Ursaluna-B, as it forces opponents to respect both a potential Tailwind from Iron Jugulis and Trick Room from Farigiraf. Both Incineroar and Ogerpon-W are great partners for Iron Jugulis; Incineroar provides Fake Out support and weakens potential threats such as Chien-Pao with Intimidate, and Ogerpon-W provides redirection to allow Iron Jugulis to set up Tailwind more easily. Flutter Mane also forms a very strong and consistent pairing with Iron Jugulis, countering opposing Dark-types that Iron Jugulis would have trouble dealing with.

  • While having a few strong resistances, Iron Jugulis's typing also means it's weak to common metagame threats such as Flutter Mane, especially the Speed Booster Energy variants, and Chien-Pao, which threaten an OHKO. Iron Jugulis also struggles against Pokemon that resist its STAB moves and can take advantage of its low damage output like Incineroar and Raging Bolt. Additionally, Iron Jugulis struggles to find a place on most teams due to it competing with Tornadus, which, unlike Iron Jugulis, has access to Prankster Tailwind, a strong Flying-type STAB move in the form of Bleakwind Storm, and Prankster Rain Dance and Sunny Day.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Snarl is helpful to slow down the plethora of strong special attackers in the format.

  • Booster Energy allows Iron Jugulis to fire off fast attacks like Snarl into opposing special attackers and set up Tailwind more easily, as well as outspeed threats such as Chien-Pao.

  • The bulk allows Iron Jugulis to survive a Extreme Speed from Choice Band Tera Normal Dragonite with Sword of Ruin active, as well as an Icicle Crash from a -1 Attack Chien-Pao. After a Snarl, Iron Jugulis lives a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane, as well as Thunderbolt from Raging Bolt.

  • Both Tera Poison and Steel are viable, but Poison is generally preferred thanks to the Fighting resistance and generally better synergy with Iron Jugulis's original type. In comparison, Tera Steel gives more resistances to powerful moves in the format like Blood Moon and Make It Rain, but it is weak to more types than Tera Poison.

Baxcalibur.overview:
• Baxcalibur's massive Attack stat, solid bulk, and STAB Ice-type moves allow it to apply immediate offensive pressure or set up to sweep. Landorus, Raging Bolt, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss fear its Ice-type STAB moves, and Incineroar and Ogerpon-W struggle to damage Baxcalibur, which opens up setup opportunities.

  • Incineroar, Rillaboom, Ogerpon-W, and Amoonguss are great teammates for Baxcalibur, providing Intimidate, Fake Out, Grassy Terrain, and redirection support to give it opportunities to set up Swords Dance and fire off its attacks. Baxcalibur also functions well on Pelipper + Archaludon rain teams, as it threatens Raging Bolt, Amoonguss, Landorus, and Rillaboom, all of which rain struggles against.

  • Steel-types like Kingambit and Gholdengo resist Baxcalibur's STAB attacks, which can hinder its ability to sweep or punch holes. In addition, the prevalence of Flutter Mane, Urshifu-R, and Urshifu-S can pressure it to Terastallize. Baxcalibur's low Speed can also make it struggle to keep up with offensive pressure from the opposing side.

Clear Amulet.description:
• With the given EV spread, Baxcalibur can outspeed -1 Landorus and survive Choice Band Wicked Blow from Urshifu-S, a Tera Stellar Sacred Sword from Chien-Pao, and a Dazzling Gleam from Choice Specs Flutter Mane.

  • Glaive Rush is Baxcalibur's best Dragon-type STAB because of its massive Base Power, with Protect offsetting the drawback. Ice Shard makes up for Baxcalibur's middling Speed tier and threatens Landorus. Icicle Crash is a good Ice-type STAB that has a chance to flinch the target. Swords Dance grants Baxcalibur a boosting move that makes it a more threatening Pokemon to the opposition.

  • Tera Poison grants Baxcalibur a to resistance Urshifu's Close Combat and Flutter Mane's Fairy-type moves while also being a great neutral type against the majority of the metagame.

  • Clear Amulet gives Baxcalibur an immunity to Intimidate from the likes of Incineroar and Hisuian-Arcanine. It also helps against Icy Wind from Flutter Mane and ElectroWeb from Assault Vest Raging Bolt.

  • Thermal Exchange prevents Baxcalibur from being burned by Wil-O-Wisp users like Incineroar in addition to deterring Ogerpon-H and Chi-Yu from using their Fire-type STAB moves.

Gholdengo.comments:
Teambuilding

  • Gholdengo works best on archetypes that can find a way to support its Make It Rain sweep. It prefers partners with Fake Out like Incineroar, Sneasler, and Rillaboom as well as redirection from Pokemon like Amoonguss and Electabuzz in order to let it set up, while Choice Specs Gholdengo pairs best with priority Tailwind setters like Talonflame, Whimsicott, and Murkrow. Dragon-types like Hydreigon and Dragapult also synergize well with Gholdengo, as they can switch into Fire-type attacks like Volcarona's Heat Wave and Incineroar's Flare Blitz, while Gholdengo switches well into the Fairy-, Dragon-, and Ice-type attacks that threaten the aforementioned Dragon-types ands hit Fairy- and Ice-types for super effective damage.

  • Nasty Plot Gholdengo synergizes well with Pokemon like Incineroar, Rillaboom, and Amoonguss that can give it turns to set up through Fake Out and Rage Powder. Choice Specs sets prefer partners with speed control options like Tailwind Whimsicott to help them against faster threats like Dragapult.

  • Gholdengo struggles against Pokemon that resist its STAB combination like Incineroar and Kingambit. Fighting- and Ground-types like Flamigo, Sneasler, Garchomp, and Ursaluna can help against bulky Dark- and Steel-types that resist Make It Rain and Shadow Ball. Garchomp is another threat, as it outspeeds Gholdengo and threatens it before and after Terastalizing with Stomping Tantrum and Dragon Claw, respectively.

Strategy Comments

  • Gholdengo's main role is to play as a sweeper. Depending on the set, it can accomplish this either by setting up with Nasty Plot or by removing opposing Steel-resistant Pokemon and then sweeping with Choice Specs-boosted Make It Rain.

  • Gholdengo is best used as an early- or late-game threat depending on the opposing team. Gameplay should focus on either removing Pokemon that can resist Make It Rain or using Gholdengo to break a hole in the opposing team and then using another strong offensive threat like Ursaluna to clean up afterwards. Nasty Plot sets are mostly used as an early-game option to take advantage of passive leads. Choice Specs sets can be used at any point in the game due to not needing to set up.

  • Kingambit and Incineroar are Gholdengo's biggest checks, as they resist its STAB attacks and can threaten it with super effective damage. Pokemon like Sneasler, Flamigo, and Paldean Tauros-W can threaten the aforementioned checks. Another method is to focus on chipping them down throughout the game before finishing them off with Gholdengo. Both Gholdengo sets struggle with smart switches, as Make It Rain lowers Special Attack, while Shadow Ball being single target leaves Gholdengo open to the other opposing Pokemon's attacks.

Bulky Setup Sweeper.description:
• Gholdengo leverages its immunities and resistances from its typing and ability to set up with Nasty Plot and sweep with Make It Rain.

  • Leftovers increases Gholdengo's survivability, while Metal Coat and Life Orb allow Gholdengo to start attacking without needing a turn to setup. Metal Coat is preferred on sets that still lean on Nasty Plot, while Life Orb sets play more like a Choice Specs set that has the option to switch moves and punish passive turns with Nasty Plot.

  • Tera Dragon allows Gholdengo to resist Fire- and Water-type attacks like Flare Blitz from Incineroar and Wave Crash from Basculegion, allowing it to set up with Nasty Plot or to start attacking after getting a boost. Tera Steel Gholdengo is typically run with Life Orb to let it pick up OHKOs on Pokemon like Primarina and Amoonguss when paired with Nasty Plot.

  • The Speed investment lets Gholdengo outspeed bulky Volcarona, while the bulk investment lets it survive Wave Crash from Choice Band Basculegion-M and Tera Dark Throat Chop from Sneasler. A Modest nature lets Metal Coat Gholdengo OHKO Ursaluna-B with Make It Rain, while a Timid nature paired with 164 Speed EVs allows it to outspeed all opposing Modest Gholdengo.

  • Pros:

  • Setup Gholdengo can easily run away with the game if its given a turn to set up.

  • Setup Gholdengo can also afford to run more bulk investment, as it can increase its Special Attack.

  • Cons:

  • Requiring a turn to set up can lead to Gholdengo being OHKOed or heavily chipped before it can start doing damage.

  • Teams featuring Nasty Plot Gholdengo often have to include more support Pokemon such as Amoonguss and Electabuzz in order to get the most value out of it, as they ensure Gholdengo will have a safe chance to set up.

All Out Attacker.description:
• Choice Specs Gholdengo uses its high Special Attack stat, decent Speed, and powerful spread move to severely dent the opposing team.

  • Thunderbolt is a good coverage option for Gholdengo to threaten Water-types that resist Make It Rain like Pelipper. Power Gem also allows Gholdengo to threaten Incineroar while still threatening Pelipper. Trick works well with Gholdengo's immunity to Fake Out to allow it to shut down setup strategies or to force Trick Room setters like Porygon2 to switch out.

  • Tera Steel maximizes Gholdengo's damage output with Make It Rain, letting it do as much damage as possible before being knocked out and allowing it to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon such as Ursaluna-B.

  • A Timid nature lets Gholdengo outspeed Modest Glimmora and Basculegion, while a Modest nature guarantees the OHKO against bulky Annihilape with Shadow Ball.

  • Pros:

  • Choice Specs Gholdengo has a very high initial damage output, not requiring the setup turn that plagues the Nasty Plot set.

  • Teams without a bulky Pokemon that resists Make It Rain can quickly be blown away.

  • Cons:

  • Choice Specs Gholdengo's inability to switch moves and lack of setup can cause its Special Attack to quickly plummet if it tries to spam Make It Rain against Pokemon like Incineroar and Kingambit. This causes it to often have to switch out, losing momentum.

Nasty Plot.description:
• Make It Rain is used for powerful STAB damage, and Shadow Ball is used as Gholdengo's Ghost-type STAB move.

  • The main item used is Leftovers so Gholdengo can stay on the field for longer. Gholdengo can also opt for Metal Coat to OHKO Flutter Mane, in sacrifice of longevity.

  • The bulk investment allows Gholdengo to almost always survive a Mystic Water Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and two Magnet-boosted Thunderclaps from Raging Bolt.

  • Gholdengo prefers Tera Fairy, but occasionally runs either Tera Steel or Dragon. Fairy allows Gholdengo to resist Urshifu-S's STAB moves and is a great defensive typing, bolstered by Gholdengo's original resistances to Steel and Poison. Tera Dragon also has great synergy with Gholdengo's Steel typing, providing welcome resistances to Ogerpon-W's STAB attacks. Tera Steel greatly increases Gholdengo's damage output and OHKOes Flutter Mane and the majority of Terastallized Pokemon, such as Tera Fairy Raging Bolt, Kingambit, and Gouging Fire.

Chien-Pao.overview:
• Chien-Pao is an excellent offensive Pokemon bearing a great offensive typing and a fantastic Speed tier. Chien-Pao is capable of taking on the majority of the format, and it's especially strong against Tornadus and Landorus thanks to its typing and Sword of Ruin.

  • Incineroar has Intimidate and resists both of Chien-Pao's STAB attacks, which makes it difficult for Chien-Pao to deal with, therefore Urshifu-R is a strong partner as it utilizes Sword of Ruin and pressures Incineroar.

  • Chien-Pao struggles to take on Urshifu-R, which can both take its attacks comfortably and outspeed it with a Choice Scarf. Urshifu-R can also threaten Chien-Pao through its Focus Sash. Terastallized Ogerpon-W and Amoonguss resist its Ice STAB moves and can redirect Sucker Punch, making them good answers to Chien-Pao.

Glass Cannon.description:
• Ice Spinner is an alternative Ice-type STAB move that provides increased accuracy and a way for teams to handle Rillaboom and Indeedee-F in exchange for higher power and a flinch chance. However, it prevents Chien-Pao from attacking Rocky Helmet Amoonguss and Latias as freely.

  • Chien-Pao uses Sacred Sword as coverage for relevant Pokemon such as Incineroar and Kingambit.

  • Chien-Pao utilizes Focus Sash to make up for its poor defensive typing combined with its lackluster bulk, as it allows it to stay an extra turn on the field to help partners exploit Sword of Ruin, which is significant for offensive compositions.

  • With Tera Stellar, Chien-Pao has the option to pick up OHKOs on Pokemon it usually wouldn't be able to OHKO, such as Flutter Mane and Amoonguss. However, it has to be wary of pivots and foes using Protect, as the power boost is temporary. Chien-Pao can also use Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and become immune to priority moves like Fake Out, which is crucial for Focus Sash.

Ting-Lu.overview:
• With excellent bulk, Vessel of Ruin, and a strong support movepool, Ting-Lu makes for a good supportive attacker. Thanks to Vessel of Ruin, it can slow down the metagame's special attacking compositions, like Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B and Flutter Mane + Chi-Yu. These traits make for a good supportive attacker and defensive wall.

  • Ting-Lu synergizes well with bulky disruptive Pokemon that can take advantage of Vessel of Ruin. Dondozo is the perfect example, as it appreciates Vessel of Ruin to more easily set up Yawns in combination with Ting Lu's Sand Tomb. Ting Lu's typing makes it weak to many of the strong physical attackers in the format, such as both Urshifu formes, Rillaboom, and the various Ogerpon formes, meaning it appreciates Incineroar's Intimidate and Amoonguss's redirection.

  • Ting Lu struggles with passivity; it's vulnerable to being overwhelmed or weakened by Intimidate easily, relying on partners to make up for its low damage. These partners can include Dragonite, which is unaffected by Intimidate and threatens big damage with priority, or Gouging Fire, which can use Howl to increase Ting Lu's offensive presence.

Sand Tomb Support.description:
• Sand Tomb is able to trap in opponents so they can't escape disruption like Yawn. Ruination and Rocky Helmet act as the main damage dealing methods, with Stomping Tantrum used as its STAB move and Body Press as a consistent source of damage when Intimidated. Taunt can be used to shut down Amoonguss and other status moves.

  • The Special Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to live Moonblast from Choice Specs Tera Fairy Flutter Mane. The Defense investment allows Ting-Lu to survive Wood Hammer from Rillaboom and Ivy Cudgel from a Terastallized Ogerpon-W.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Bulky Attacker.description:
• Heavy Slam allows Ting-Lu to OHKO Flutter Mane, while Ruination and Body Press provide consistent damage. Alternatively, Throat Chop can be used as a reliable Dark-Type STAB move that can also prevent Parting Shot from Incineroar and Hyper Voice from Ursaluna-B.

  • Ting-Lu uses Assault Vest to bolster its special bulk. The EV spread allows Ting-Lu to survive 3 Moonblasts from Flutter Mane, and it also almost always lives Surging Strikes from Tera Water Urshifu-R. The Attack investment ensures an OHKO on Flutter Mane with Heavy Slam.

  • Tera Poison is the most consistent Tera type for Ting-Lu, as it provides a resistance to Flutter Mane's Moonblast, the STAB moves of Rillaboom, and Close Combat from the Urshifu formes.

Chi-Yu.overview:
• With an excellent Special Attack stat, which is bolstered by Beads of Ruin and great STAB moves, Chi-Yu threatens its foes with the highest damage output in the format and Chi-Yu is capable of OHKOing the majority of the metagame. Beads of Ruin also helps increase Chi-Yu's partner's offensive pressure.

  • Chi-Yu struggles due to its mediocre Speed stat, so speed control from Tornadus and Speed Booster Energy Flutter Mane is greatly appreciated. Choice Scarf Chi-Yu prefers teaming up with offensive threats like Choice Specs Flutter Mane to make up for the lost damage output. Tornadus and Flutter Mane can also help take care of the Urshifu formes, which threaten Chi-Yu, while Chi-Yu can in return increase their damage output with Beads of Ruin as well as remove Steel-types like Kingambit.

  • Chi-Yu struggles against Pokemon that can take its attacks and either hinder it or exploit its weak defensive profile. Incineroar and Raging Bolt are great answers to Chi-Yu, as they can comfortably take all of its attacks and disrupt it through tools such as Fake Out, Knock Off, Parting Shot, Electroweb, and Snarl. Once Terastallized, Ogerpon-W also takes Chi-Yu's attacks incredibly well and threatens an OHKO on it with Ivy Cudgel.

Choice Attacker.description:
• Snarl is used as utility and a way to check special attacking compositions such as Farigiraf + Ursaluna-B. Overheat is appreciated as a single target nuke, hitting almost twice as hard as Heat Wave.

  • Choice Specs is used to give Chi-Yu maximum offensive pressure and allow it to pick up OHKOes on Amoonguss and Kingambit with Heat Wave. Alternatively, Chi-Yu can opt for Choice Scarf to outspeed threats like Landorus, Chien-Pao, and Flutter Mane.

  • The HP EVs allow for Chi-Yu to avoid the 2HKO from Flutter Mane's Moonblast and once Terastallized into the Ghost-type, almost always survive -1 Adamant Chien-Pao's Sucker Punch. The Speed EVs allow Chi-Yu to outspeed the Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Chi-Yu prefers Tera Ghost to remove its Fighting weakness and be immune to common priority moves like Fake Out and Extreme Speed, which is crucial to preserve momentum. Although Chi-Yu can utilize Tera Fire to significantly increase its damage output, allowing Choice Scarf Chi-Yu to OHKO Ogerpon-W and Flutter Mane with Overheat and Choice Specs variants to remove Assault Vest Kingambit and Rillaboom with Heat Wave.

Roaring Moon.overview:
• Roaring Moon provides a niche as either a fast speed control option or setup sweeper thanks to the Prankster immunity provided by its Dark typing and access to Attack and Speed Booster Energy, further bolstered by its superb movepool. Roaring Moon's Dark-type STAB moves and excellent elemental resistances make it a great answer to Iron Crown and Gholdengo, as well as the Ogerpon formes.

  • Roaring Moon appreciates partners such as Ogerpon-W, Amoonguss, and Incineroar, which help it to set up Tailwind or Dragon Dance through free turns, the former two handle threats like Urshifu-R and Flutter Mane exceptionally well. Ogerpon-W greatly benefits from Tailwind, while Amoonguss has superb defensive synergy with Roaring Moon; all partners enjoy Breaking Swipe as well. With Acrobatics, Dragon Dance Roaring Moon can help the former two by removing the powder-immune Grass-types and help Incineroar by threatening both Urshfiu formes. Flutter Mane is also a great beneficiary of Roaring Moon, handling opposing Flutter Mane and both Urshifu formes with Tailwind support, and Breaking Swipe protecting it from the physical attackers it's weak to.

  • Roaring Moon's typing, while welcoming fantastic resistances, also invites weaknesses to some of the metagame's most popular threats like the aforementioned Flutter Mane, both Urshifu formes, and Chien-Pao. Roaring Moon can notably mitigate the latter two's damage output if running Breaking Swipe and break Urshifu-S and Chien-Pao's Focus Sash in the process but requires support against them. Incineroar also poses an issue for Roaring Moon, as it resists Knock Off and weakens Roaring Moon with Intimidate. Incineroar's Fake Out can also be used to stall Tailwind turns.

Dragon Dance Sweeper.description:
• Dragon Dance allows Roaring Moon to be an effective sweeper and helps reset Intimidate Attack drops, making it harder to slow down.

  • Roaring Moon utilizes Attack Booster Energy to activate Acrobatics, allowing for an OHKO on many centralizing Fighting- and Grass-types, such as the various Urshifu and Ogerpon formes, as well as Amoonguss after Terastalization.

  • After Terastalization, the bulk investment allows Roaring Moon to always survive a Tera Water-boosted Surging Strikes from Urshifu-R and a Thunderclap from a Special Attack Booster Energy Raging Bolt. The Speed investment allows Roaring Moon to outspeed Adamant Urshifu formes.

  • Roaring Moon uses Tera Flying to obtain a resistance to Fighting-type moves and to gain STAB on Acrobatics.

Tailwind Support.description:
• Roaring Moon utilizes Breaking Swipe to weaken the metagame's plethora of physical attackers such as the Ogerpon formes and Rillaboom.

  • Roaring Moon uses Speed Booster Energy to outspeed the entire unboosted metagame and get off Tailwind and Breaking Swipe more consistently.

  • The HP combined with the Defense EVs allow for Roaring Moon to take Adamant Chien-Pao's Icicle Crash at -1. The Special Defense EVs allow Roaring Moon to almost always survive unboosted Flutter Mane's Dazzling Gleam, as well as a Dragon Pulse from Raging Bolt.
